reviews.text: Great service today. Huge menu! There was no wait which is always a treat. They have weekend lunch specials that are valid through 5 pm on the weekend.

We went there on Sunday,  it was 9 of us. THEY gave us a new server, she was only there for 3 days,  I  don&#39;t think they should of gave her a large group like that.<br>As we got seated , she took our order. We got our appetizers which was delicious but....<br>We waited almost an hour to receive our dinner, by than we were all tired and ready to leave so we asked for take out containers. <br>Other than that the food was delicious

I called to place an order by phone and the person that answered the phone asked me if I tried to place the order online, I said no and she said it would be a lot faster. I told her I would order from somewhere else that didn&#39;t mind taking orders over the phone. Laziness is not a good thing when you&#39;re running a business.

The CheeseCake factory is one of my go to restaurants were I know I&#39;ll  get a good meal. Their food is always consistent and most of the time the service is good. I must admit that I pick and choose when I go there because it can get really crowded and a wait long. Unfortunately there is no call ahead seating, so on a Friday or Saturday night you could easily have over a hour wait.<br>Out with my husband and decided to stop in for some lunch.<br>We started with some hot wings as an appetizer.  They were a little too spicy for my taste, but my husband loved them. Next time I&#39;ll get the sauce on the side.<br>I got a California Cheese Steak and a side salad.  To be honest, it was pretty good, but they were very stingy on the meat. May not order this again. but the roll was nice and fresh as was the salad.<br>My husband got a Bacon, Bacon Cheeseburger and Sweet potato fries.  He said it was delicious, cooked just right.  The portion size was great. <br>Both of us could only eat half our sandwich.  It was probably the delicious warm bread and butter they give you before your food comes out. <br>We skipped on the Cheesecake .....maybe next time!<br>The waitress was knowledgeable and efficient as well, differently knows her job. <br>It was a nice afternoon with good food and good company!

Came here for happy hour food 4pm to 6pm, while I was shopping. <br><br>I honestly am really disturbed by how dark it is in here. I have really bad astigmatism. I can&#39;t see when it&#39;s even heavily lit, let alone when everything is lit by candle light. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory, it&#39;s 5pm on a Monday. I don&#39;t know if you&#39;re trying to conserve energy or what but this is ridiculous. I had my husband pick out our food because I could not see. The couple next to use had to use their phone light to read the menu. <br><br>I didn&#39;t even end up ordering cheesecake out of frustration. The light from my phone while writing this review is killing my eyes, due to the contrast.  <br><br>My husband picked out...<br><br>Sliders: decent portion (4 sliders),<br>Comes with slaw, pickles and ketchup. It could use a little seasoning on the meat. $6.50 <br><br>Tex-mex spring rolls: I really like the sauce they came with. Large portion, easily split between two people. The spring rolls themselves weren&#39;t that great. I took one bite and put it back down. $6.50<br><br>Tamale cakes: sauce is amazing, the cakes are dry but flavorful. $6.50<br><br>Overall.. I would only come here to pick up cheesecake to go. Not really a place to bring your kids.

It&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory, what else is there to say? It&#39;s not exceptional but not too shabby either. <br><br>I don&#39;t usually do big chain restaurants but this place is kinda convenient especially if you&#39;ve put in a couple of hours shopping around the mall.  <br><br>I usually sit at the bar and almost always have gotten good service there. They have a good variety of menus - apps, lunch, dinner, etc. From what I remember, they have a pretty good happy hour. The food portions are huge so I feel like you get a lot of bang for your buck. <br><br>I&#39;m not a big dessert person but if you are, they got you covered...especially if you&#39;re into cheesecake ;).

Cheesecake Factory may be the quintessential modern American diner. Huge diverse menu and awesome desserts. Yeah, it doesn&#39;t exactly look like a stainless roadside palace; designed to appear more like a massive adobe warehouse on the outside and something out of the fantasiful Arabian Nights, within. While not a regular visitor, sometimes it is exactly what I am looking for, especially when the answer to every existential question is, &#34;cheesecake!&#34;<br><br>It certainly filled that bill last night. We weren&#39;t sure what we wanted for dinner, but knew what we didn&#39;t. Tired of checking off all the ethnic styles available within driving distance and eliminating most of them, we came to Cheesecake Factory. It had dishes from all continents, a bar, and those awesome creamy sweet cool desserts. Perfect cure for indecisiveness. We drove to Willow Grove in about 30. The expansive hall was busy but not full. We were seated immediately near the bar.<br><br>We caught the final minutes of happy hour and celebrated with half price glasses of an excellent cabernet. We selected the Crispy Brussel Sprouts for an appetizer (wonderfully done with bacon and maple syrup), and their Southwest Chicken Sandwich (strong contender in a crunchy baguette and spicy aioli), and Shepherd&#39;s Pie (savory ground beef and veggies in mushroom gravy topped with a load of mashed potatoes and melted cheese). Toasting our way through the meal, we completed with a flourish of a thick slice of shared almond cheesecake (they bake them right). <br><br>This was a full and fun dinner that permitted us to chose cravings that we didn&#39;t know we had. We couldn&#39;t finish any of it, and brought enough home for another meal. Cheesecake Factory may not see us again for a while, but it&#39;s good to know it&#39;s there when we need the modern American diner to help us decide what to eat.

I always like going to the cheesecake factory. I am normally pleased with my meal each time I go with the exception of their brunch and my visit yesterday. I got a cobb salad with salmon instead of chicken and it was $23.50!!!!!!! They gave me the smallest peice of salmon that I have ever seen. I was completely disappointed! For such an expensive salad, you would have thought I wld get an adult sized peice of salmon not a toddler portion. It was a complete ripoff! And I am sure someone checked the meal before I got it, so that says a whole lot about their quality control or lack thereof.... SMH! Guess, I&#39;ll have to put then time out for awhile. I dont have money to waste on an awful meal.:(

Had an excellent dinner date tonight. We were seated right away, introduced to our waitress and ordered as soon as we were ready. The Korean fried cauliflower was such a delicious and flavorful appetizer that I highly recommend. Our waitress was also wonderful, very kind and continued to check on us through out the night..she even started us out with two loafs of the brown bread instead of one which was obviously what we were craving :P<br>For my entree I had a combination of herb grilled salmon and shrimp scampi. It was a small portion of shrimp (only three) with a very large side of mashed potatoes. I left extremely full with plenty of leftovers for tomorrow, but of course topped off my dinner with a chocolate tuxedo cheesecake. This one is my favorite and I recommend it if you&#39;re a chocolate lover or not a fan of traditional cheesecake.

Get ready to wait for an hour and a half and if you don&#39;t not want to sit down get ready for your food to be an hour wait and freezing not just cold .. very upset since this was my place ever since I was a child, sad to say I can&#39;t come here anymore rude service as well .
Hair cooked right into the chicken. It&#39;s great when I have to thrown out a 19 dollar dish.

So, I called the restaurant directly to place an order and was asked if I would hold briefly. I agreed. After about 20 minutes on hold I decided to place an online order...while still on hold. The online order would be ready quicker than I had already been on hold. Just for fun I maintained the call all the way to the restaurant to pick up my order. After showing the manager, Ryan, the still continuing call (40 min) he had no answer, no excuses, and no customer relation answer. He just had a deer in the headlights look and sent me on my way  as there was another couple waiting behind me with their own complaint. By the way, the restaurant was maybe 10% full. <br>Also ordered a medium-well burger and got (see pic). Not a fan of this location.

The food here can get salty, but most of the food on the menu is set. You pretty much know what to expect when you go there. I got the New York style steak and I enjoyed it very much. The meat was decently seasoned and medium rare. I would go back for the steak.

This is definitely one of my favorite restaurants to go to ....I mean I&#39;m like a kid in a candy store when I&#39;m in cheese cake factory and it has nothing to do with the cheese cake but everything to do with the service and the menu! <br><br>I visited 5/9/19 around noon and my waitress&#39;s name was Alexis. Alexis was attentive, smiled often, asked if we were alright frequently, paid attention to our dislikes, and recommended an amazing cheesecake. <br><br>I ordered my favorite the famous chicken Madeira--it traditionally comes with mushrooms but I substituted them for peppers and a side of teriyaki sauce. My son ordered a raspberry lemonade and chicken fingers and fries and as always he was awwwweedddd at the taste of their honey mustard. We double downed on the brown bread and enjoyed fresh breaded buffalo wings with a side of blue cheese....I also ordered a passion fruit margarita and it was rather  tasty. <br><br>I was like super full off of my meal but ummmmm how do you come to cheese cake factory and not get cheese cake? With the help of Alexis I finalized my cheese cake order to select the Cinnabon cheesecake and it took me a day and a half to finish it ---not because it was enormous in size but because you know this thing has approximately 1370 calories in it and it&#39;s like sooooo doggone good you just don&#39;t want the goodness to end...so I prolonged finishing it ...I mean I still don&#39;t want that taste to go &#34;bye bye&#34;. <br><br>All in all I&#39;m a firm believer that you can&#39;t go wrong at the Cheesecake Factory --the menu is intense you have so much to choose from, and it also caters to your diet including skinny margaritas etc.....hands down one of my favorite places to go and thanks again to my waitress Alexis for making my experience an amazing experience once again. :) <br><br>And the bathrooms were extra clean!!!!

So I had an amazing dinner tonight at cheesecake with some of my girlfriends. What made my dinner even better was my waiter joey and the busser Connor. They&#39;ve made our dinner so nice. We will be coming back!!! Oh and , AMAZING FOOD

First, I will start that the atmosphere was impeccable. I love sitting outside, but after seeing how gorgeous it was inside, I changed my mind. Our waitress was attentive, and our food came out in a timely manner. They started us out with a free bread basket (the oat bread is phenomenal) and brought us a second one as well. We had the stuffed mushrooms as an appetizer. They were absolutely delicious, and we dipped our bread in the leftover sauce in the dish because it was too good to waste. I&#39;m glad we tried it, but I don&#39;t know of I&#39;d get it again because of the price. I got the lunch sized portion of the farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic. Even the lunch sized portion was so much I had to take some home. It was the most  delectable pasta dish I have ever eaten. It had the fresh bite of peas, black pepper seasoned chicken, savory mushrooms, juicy tomatoes, and salty panchetta. The flavors melded together amazingly. My boyfriend got the marsala chicken. Pricy, but a good portion size for the price. They used bowtie noodles and breaded chicken for this dish. He said the wine sauce was cooked perfectly, and the overall taste was tangy. He said the dish could&#39;ve used more sauce in general, and the chicken was cut pretty thin, if that is something that bothers you. For dessert, I had the caramel pecan turtle cheesecake. Yummmmmmmy. A pecan brownie topped with caramel cheesecake, caramel turtle pecan topping, and a fudgy swirl. This is one of the best desserts I have ever eaten. My boyfriend got the Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar cheesecake. He said there was plenty of chocolate, very sweet, and the whipped cream was real and not artificial tasting. Overall, I highly recommend dining here. Be prepared to spend a pretty penny, but the portion sizes make it well worth the price.

This place is terrible, we made a reservation for outside dining for my 87 year old grandmother only to be told they&#39;re not serving outside. Ok, no big deal I thought. Told me we&#39;d still have to wait for a table inside even though I had a reservation to begin with. With it being dirty and smelly and crammed people I skipped it and went to the yard house next door, which was amazing! Nobody that worked at the Cheesecake Factory seemed to care, manager was a joke, and for the amount they charge for sub par food, I would avoid this place like the plague!

Tried their egg roll sampler--  very good.  The dipping sauces were just the right amount. It was fun to mix and match the sauces with the egg rolls. The avocado egg roll wasn&#39;t the prettiest- but it was the tastiest. (Egg rolls were avacado, Tex mex, cheeseburger and chicken taquito)<br><br>Always love coming here- wish it was closer.   Server was nice and prompt. Only had to wait 45 minutes. <br><br>And of course, finished it off with their Dulce De Leche Carmel Cheesecake.. the ultimate best slice!! Had to take it to go- too full.

I like this place when its not busy once they get packed the food isn&#39;t as consistent. I ordered soup and the miso  salmon. My soup was barely warm and my miso  salmon was just fish on top of a bed of rice. That is the dish but it had no vegetables and no crispy wontons, like it was rushed. I ordered brown rice it came with white drowned  in butter, the bartender offered  to change it but I hate to send food back. The fish tasted very good  but the whole experience was ho hum.

Cheesecake factory so good. I had steak tacos.... they were so good.. yes a little expensive. But as the saying goes you get what you pay for.... Also had a peice of original cheese cake. Being known for cheese cake. Definitely by far the best around. I aways like to arrive early and eat. Because about 5pm It starts to get packed. Get there by 4... The server was great. On it with drinks and bringing the food out in minutes.... Coming back to the table seeing if I needed anything...<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back in the near future... Might try the lunch specials!!
Food is always good. Vince our server is always professional, knowledgeable and kind. Our go to spot.
Terrible. My boyfriend and I made reservations and waited for an hour just to eat. Employees were rude and unprofessional.

I ordered the fish and chips but we got fried shrimp and fries.  Now this is not totally off shrimp is a fish, but when you can&#39;t shrimp it&#39;s a problem.  But not all was lost the wife ate it and said it was OK.  She ordered chicken quesadilla, her&#39;s came but it didn&#39;t have any chicken in it and was only filled with vegetables.  I ate it and was just ok. The lemon raspberry cheesecake we ordered for dessert was very good.

I came here for my birthday with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. Our server Joey was beyond great.  Great service and Attitude and he was very attentive. Food was great as always. Will definitely be back.  Thank you.
Absolutely amazing as always ! Had a great time! In this post , pictures are over a thousand words ! We always enjoy ourselves here!

I had jambalaya pasta. It was awful. Green dry noodles I didnt ask for.  Two pieces of chicken and three shrimp with pieces of shell still on them. A huge oversize plate of dry noodles and five peices of meat. Just sad<br><br>The biggest problem my drink was so disgusting  I vomited alllll night. I had a soda and I couldnt see because of the suds. Once I drunk half I saw my cup  was so dirty there was residue sticking to the glass. The particles were floating around in my drink and I consumed it. Smh pisssseddd

Far worst cheesecake factory that I&#39;ve been. Ordered shrimp with angel hair and Louisiana pasta. Shrimp came out half burnt, tomato pasta was watery and had no flavor. Louisiana pasta tasted nothing as well. I do not expect much from a chain restaurant; but damn..

I have heard a lot about the Cheesecake Factory and I may have ate at one before but it wasn&#39;t memorable so here you go.  We came to this location because some friends of ours love this place and they wanted us to meet them here.  <br><br>I thought it was going to be a long wait but it was a small 5 minute wait to seat our party of 4.  The hostess was nice and our waitress was friendly, patient and she had some nice recommendations for us.  <br><br>The food was really good.   None of us had any complaints about our food orders.  I enjoyed the shrimp scampi for my dinner.  For dessert I had the Very Cherry Chocolate Cheesecake.  It was incredible!  <br><br>If you get a chance be sure to stop by this location for good service and great food.

I went here yesterday just for a happy hour and to enjoy the weather since it was my day off. I was able to sit outside on the terrace and enjoy the sun and breeze. I ordered a glass of Riesling! And had a lunch special of the Four Cheese Pasta which was pretty good. I was off and in no rush to go anywhere so I was there for about 2 hours. Enjoyed my time and the waiters were nice! And attentive

My favorite restaurant. Large portions, great prices, great food. The chicken sliders are my favorite. Their mozzarella sticks are great too. Too many great cheesecake options to list. Salivating as I write this.

No surprises here!<br>My wife and I have been to this location for for years but I must say tonight&#39;s experience was by far the best.My wife ordered the chicken piccata, I had the grilled pork chop with mashed potatoes and green beans, we both shared the calamari as an appetizer, and two slices of cheesecake to go to wrap up our meal. All were excellent. This review and 5 stars are for our waiter Joseph B. We sat at table 53 around 5:30 pm. Joseph was on point all night, friendly, knowledgeable with the menu and our questions and always seemed to be right there at our table whenever we needed something even though the restaurant was busy. It made our usual good visit an exceptional one and we thought he should be recognized for his outstanding service.

The Cheesecake Factory is a place to go when you are throwing all caution to the wind about your diet ... or so I thought! I didn&#39;t want an insanely thick dinner+dessert so I opted to pick from their low-calorie menu for dinner, known as the Skinnylicious menu. I&#39;m not going to lie, I really dislike that name - I felt really silly ordering the Skinnylicious shrimp tacos. But I was surprised at the plate when it came out, I was expecting dinky little taco shells with maybe a single shrimp in each to help keep the calories low But I was pleasantly surprised at the portion size. <br><br>Generally, the food itself was fine. Nothing bad, just nothing to write home about. The tacos were a little bland. And I&#39;ve noticed that as well with other meals I&#39;ve had at various Cheesecake Factory locations too, not necessarily specific to this location. I&#39;ve never had a bad meal there, I just feel like in a restaurant where most everything is on its A-game, the entrees are just okay. <br><br>I got the low carb Cheesecake with strawberries. This more than makes any meal there worth it, and is what keeps us going back. It was unbelievably tasty and rich. My wife got the celebration cheesecake which had some birthday cake baked into it. We of course shared, and both were top notch. <br><br>Also, top marks go to our server Lexi. She was great. She handled her job well, but was definitely keeping us laughing and smiling every time she stopped by to check in on us. She should be commended for her great attitude and sense of humor. Whenever we go back, we will hope to be served by her every time we go. <br><br>A fun little observation: some of the decor in there reminds me of the Eye Of Sauron from the Lord Of The Rings movies. I always enjoy that each time I go.

This place is great! A little over priced for my liking, but it was worth it! <br>Our waitress was amazing and as well as the food. A couple other people and I just shared a appetizer and a meal. We got the chicken pot stickers which were amazing! I never had them before, so I was glad that it was very tasteful. We also got the fish tacos which were fried and they were great as well! A little bite to them but nothing too bad. <br>We sadly did not get any dessert because of being full from what we all had ate. But, I did grab the raspberry cheesecake for the way home and it was creamy and delightful! <br>I would definitely come back! And I definitely recommend this place! <br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory

Umm.... For take out I was under impressed. I asked for a medium burger and got well done. It is almost burned.... As you can see so much char...I don&#39;t know how I feel about the deconstructed burger or the fact that the cheese in the Mac and cheese came separate....

Lol I used to love this place , went 3x but my last visit trumped the 1st two. Food was disgusting, me &amp; my gf normally order the same thing because it never fails but they managed to fail. Noodles were over cooked, tasted bland, well done steak for our friends was rare, drinks were watery &amp; the manager on staff was a jerk, we sent the food back to give them another chance to fix it &amp; he brought the same food back out, we sent it back &amp; vowed to never support there business again. Very very poor customer service.

My experience at The Cheesecake Factory was far less than satisfactory.  I had placed an order for Pick-Up on 4/4/20.  My family and I were looking forward to a good meal, as that is our usual experience with The Cheesecake Factory. We ordered a few cold items as well as a few hot items.  We had specified and called to make sure the cold items stayed separate from the hot items ( this should be standard practice).  When <br> I arrived for pick-up, the hot and cold items were in the same bag.  Essentially that ruined my salad (greens were all wilted and cheese was melted). Another disappointment was the chicken and pasta entree.  While the chicken was very good and was a decent portion, the pasta was almost non-existent. For an almost $20 entree this was extremely disappointing.  It was almost like the ran out of pasta and just gave us what was left.  All in all for the money spent which was near $100 the quality and quantity was extremely disappointing.  To be fair, I do realize they may have been overwhelmed with the influx of take out and delivery orders - I just wish they kept up with their quality and consumer expectations.

I come here for lunch maybe twice a month by myself and I have a great experience each time. I have a different server each time and they are always prompt and attentive. I never have to wait long for anything! Granted I go during the day in the middle of the week but some restaurants can&#39;t even handle a slow day! Also a big plus, the bathrooms are pretty tidy!

This location need to close or obtain new management.  I&#39;ve ordered food twice in two months from this location and the food has been cold on both occasions.  It&#39;s overall poor service here.  Don&#39;t waste your time, spend your money elsewhere.

I was very disappointed this trip to the Cheesecake Factory. I called the night before and they said I had to make reservations on Yelp. I did this and wrote we need to be outside because we have elderly high risk individuals coming and I thanked them for this. We arrived and no one was outside- it was a Saturday at lunch time. They told us they were not doing outside seating. They said they were no tables in the hallway of mall either. Then they said we would have to wait for a table despite our reservation. Another older lady came in and asked why she couldn&#39;t sit outside and was upset. Long story short we took our 87 year old grandmother on oxygen to the restaurant across the hall where they quickly accommodated our situation. If you have outside seating during COVID can we please use it? And if there are not going to be tables please be courteous enough to call us so we can go somewhere else and not make our grandmother walk all around for an open restaurant. I was highly disappointed and the hostess was not empathetic or helpful. We won&#39;t be coming back anytime soon!

Feeling pretty annoyed and let down. I know everything sucks at the moment. This is a &#34;first world problem&#34;... i promised my kids a nice dinner after being stuck in the house/doing all their chores and online homework. We ordered $129 worth of takeout. The takeout people on the phone were great. The food was gross. Half asked portions (iv ordered these dishes before multiple times).. the salad/tomatoes/vegetables were inedible. All the food tasted old! Perhaps they should have just said  they couldn&#39;t make the dishes instead? Iv worked in restaurants my entire life. I&#39;m sure the managers are getting pressure to sell what&#39;s left In stock from corporate.. but what a waste of my money! I would have made out better going to Wawa, and saved $90. Never ordering there again.
Great food, love their cakes. Awesome atmosphere, great for any one in any occasion. Would definitely recommend and is now one of my favorite restaurant to dine in. Thanks

For the second time in a month I get home to see they forgot something. I asked if everything was in there they said yes. I asked on a few specific things told yes everything. Stamped at the top of the recipient it says &#34; DONT FORGET DESSERT &#34; what did they forget? It&#39;s Father&#39;s Day, you don&#39;t want to not have dessert. I call wait 14 minutes on the phone to be told I can come back. I live in Horsham, not around the corner. The manager was no help. NOT GOING BACK!!

Another chain serving sub par low quality food at outrageous prices !  <br><br>Asked for the small crab cakes was told they don&#39;t have such an item on menu.   Opened menu and there they were called crab bites !   Hmm crab meat mayo dipped in panko and fried sounds like crab cakes go me!!<br><br>Incinerated pork chop completely inedible !  Rare steak served so over cooked and grey there was no juice! Broccoli served with mold still on the florets!<br><br>Bathroom floor covered in urine !   Final insult presented a bill for $48.54 for food sent back and not eaten  and waiting more than ten minutes for them to take my card!  <br><br>After being disgusted beyond comprehension I asked a waitress if she could take my bill and card and process payment was met with the comment do I look like I was your waitress ?   I was not your server you&#39;ll have to wait for her to come back !<br><br>Are you out of your mind?  WTF ??? Really you refuse to take my payment and want me to wait for my server to return !!! <br><br>Never again!  Just say no to the chains and subpar mediocrity !<br><br>As you can see folks by their reply it&#39;s a total who gives a crap attitude !
Top selections and generous portions. Love the Cuban sandwich and the Louisiana Chicken pasta, good burgers too

Came to the Cheesecake Factory for lunch after shopping around in the Willow Grove Mall to mini celebrate my boyfriends birthday. <br>We ordered the appetizers- Ahi tuna and Thai lettuce wraps for starters. The waiter was super nice to explain the difference between the regular size Thai lettuce wraps and the appetizer sizes, very useful since I only wanted a small portion. The service around us was super friendly, the busboy offered new knives every time we dropped ours ( happened about twice). <br>The wait for our food took about 30 minutes which we didn&#39;t mind since it was lunch time and we were full from the 2 rounds of bread. (The bread is my favorite part about the Cheesecake Factory, the whole grain bread is nowhere to be found outside of this restaurant !)<br><br>To add to this review - the bathrooms were incredibly disgusting. Each stall were dirty with paper everywhere and had no toilet paper. Usually I wouldn&#39;t comment on this aspect, but this is pretty unsanitary for a restaurant in which servers, chiefs, and employees utilize.

I&#39;m not why they bother to include a empty fucking box with crumbs in it next to my burger. 16$ burger to go and i immediately realized that I should have gone to burger king and got a whopper meal at least if im missing shit i didnt pay $16 for a cold ass burger and i guess this is just the normal amount of fries that cheesecake gives out. Funny thing is i opened them and didnt even eat 1 fucking frie because I lost my appetite, because if I want some fucking crumbs Ill go through my fucking carpet and lick the floor, but dont put that shit on a plate and pretend thats a fucking meal what an insult. I am never ordering from this fucking place again and they slipping with their food all watered down and tasteless. guess there is a reason theres all those parked cars in front of cheese cake but the only resturaunt full is Yard House LOL. go fuck yourself you fuckers who need to learn to how to cook I am never eating here again this place is a fucking disgrace as an american resturaunt its just simply trash...

Before I write this review, I just wanted to say that I tried to address this matter over the Cheesecake factory website but they never responded or addressed a major concern I had over my experience.<br><br>I went to the Cheesecake factory on Tuesday, December 5th around 7pm. Even though it was busy, we were promptly seated at a table, no complaints there. We ordered the appetizer and it was pretty delicious (chicken samosas). Service was very slow and eventually my entree (fish and chips) finally came out. It tasted pretty good but in one of the bites I took of the battered fish, I thought I had a &#34;bone&#34; in my mouth. It was very hard and impossible to chew, and upon removing the &#34;bone&#34; from my mouth I actually saw that it was a shiny piece of metal *drum roll here*.. A STAPLE. That is right, somehow a staple ended up in my fish.<br><br>I promptly told the waitress that I wouldn&#39;t be eating this any further because of my concern that possibly another staple could be in my food. I really wish I was making up this story because literally my whole night was ruined. The waitress took it away and said that my meal and any dessert I chose would be on the house. She also offered me another meal, however I declined. She said it could have been a piece of metal from the frying bin? LIKE WHY IS THE FRYING BIN FALLING APART? HOW IS THAT OK?<br><br>SO there we have it, my awful experience at the Cheesecake factory. If you go, be careful and weary. <br><br>This definitely raised a huge red flag for me. I don&#39;t like to question the integrity and safety of my food so I most likely won&#39;t be returning to any of the locations.  <br><br>On a side note, I had a friend that was served glass in his water at another location. <br><br>Cheers.

3.5 stars Chain restaurants are my least favorite places to dine. This particular chain however does offer a lot of variety so for that, I like it. The menu, as many of you know is absolutely huge and extensive. There is something for everyone... the health-conscious and the ones who want to splurge on big giant piece of nine dollar cheesecake alike. There are also gluten-free and dairy free items clearly marked. I do love Ana greatly appreciate that all menu items are listed with their calorie content and have been way before it was trendy. I also like the option to get a lunch sized portion of any of their dinner entrees. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to three different locations, center city, KOP and this one. This location is OK. They all pretty much look the same with that somewhat Tuscan decor and all locations are pretty large. I have personally never had to wait here, but I usually come during the day, during the week. <br><br>This spot makes for a good stop mid shopping spree and I think that the area and the mall alike needed something like. This Cheesecake Factory is a good option if you&#39;re looking for a sit-down meal rather than takeout from the food court while here at Willow Grove. I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to come here, but for a mall day, it&#39;s a good option. <br><br>I&#39;ve never had a bad meal here. My go to lately is the vegan Cobb. It&#39;s huge and tasty. It can easily be made into two meals or split amongst the entire table. Try it! Crispy and crunchy!<br><br>Prices are fair, portions are hearty and service here has been pretty good each time we have visited. If you&#39;re starving fear not, they start you with delicious warm bread and creamy house butter right away! <br><br>Be a good wife and grab a slice of decadent, rich cheesecake for hubs so he won&#39;t mind how much you spent that day :)

We just had the worst experience. Everything came out late! We ordered an appetizer which took forever and it was just nachos (soggy) and then our entree took a decade to come out and my order was a salad which didn&#39;t need much cooking. And then to top it off they kept saying 3 more mins for my husbands entree to to come out because something happened in the kitchen. It was just not a good experience overall. The only thing that was ok was the waiter he was very nice and apoplectic about the whole situation <br><br>The manager was the one that came to us and told us it would be 3 more mins btw! he should know there was a problem if he had to come to us and say that himself.
Long wait times, but the food is worth it.they do accept reservations, you simply have to make sure that you are there on time.

Shrimp scampi for me,<br>Fried Mac &amp; Cheese Balls for my youngest,<br>And Oreo cheesecake for me babe!<br>Soooooooooooooo goooooooood! Everybody loved what they got. This is one of my top places I love to go to in the area.
The woman who takes my togo order today doesnt have any service mind at all. Poor!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br>Update: and it takes 30 mins to get 2 slices of chessecake!!!!!!

I went to The Cheesecake Factory with my hubby and got the usual!! Fettuccine Alfredo. Delicious! My hubby got chicken costoletta!! And we had the sweetest most helpful waitress Keira! She we never had an empty glass! AMAZING service. The food is always great but Keira really made our date night enjoyable with her great service.

The Cheesecake Factory, as thorough as it&#39;s menu is (there&#39;s like a hundred items!) seems to always be packed and people, for the most part, look happy. <br><br>I went on a Saturday afternoon with my girlfriend and sister, expecting to be welcomed with tons of people and a fairly decent wait - I was not let down. <br><br>We ordered the &#34;Buffalo Blast&#34; as an app, and ordered the &#34;Truffle Honey Chicken,&#34; &#34;Pasta Da Vinci,&#34; and &#34;Chicken, Mango, and Avocado Salad.&#34; The latter two were based on previous favorites of ours, we highly recommend them. The Truffle Honey Chicken was a new try, and enjoyed our chicken, though it was a bit boring. <br><br>The waitress was very helpful and ready to help, though she was stretched thin based on the sheer volume of people there. I&#39;d recommend it for a people ready to hang up their shopping goals for a several long break.<br><br>Overall, the Cheesecake Factory is consistently decent food at a slightly shy of modest price point. It&#39;s regularly packed and I expect that, though it won&#39;t be anyone&#39;s favorite place, it&#39;s consistency is commendable. <br><br>-----------------------------------------------<br><br>Update 5/31/18:<br><br>Bumping my previous 3 star rating to 4 star because of the helpfulness of the management staff. I came here for a cheesecake with my girlfriend, and had forgotten an empty shopping bag with an important receipt in it. It turns out that, thinking it was just trash, they threw it out. Justine, the manager, spent ton of time looking for it for me and ultimately found it. I have to commend the helpfulness of the staff, thank you so much!

I don&#39;t think I will return to this location. My table was dirty and so was the plate. Clearly no one bothered to clean the table between customers. I ordered the chicken Madeira / herb salmon combo. After waiting about 40 minutes it arrived, Tiny portion with very little sauces, The salmon tasted good but was dry. The sad, lightly sauced chicken breast was not cooked through. I asked the waitress to take it back. She wanted to take away the salmon too and I said no, I waited way too long already and i was hungry. <br>About 25 minutes later the new chicken arrived, exactly as before except the edges were lightly browned. I asked for a manager who proceeded to tell me I was wrong and the chicken was cooked through. <br>It was futile to argue so I asked that he take a few dollars off the check, which he agreed to do. I then ordered a slice of plain cheesecake and it was great. The meal was so expensive, even with a few dollars off for my trouble. I should have just gotten the cheesecake to go. It was made elsewhere most likely so they couldn&#39;t ruin it. Ironically it says chicken Madeira is the most popular dish. Hey, even I can cook a chicken breast and I am not a great cook, lol!

I love going to this particular Cheesecake Factory because it&#39;s close, it&#39;s next to the mall, and the food is usually very well prepared. However, I was rather disheartened to find a piece of plastic in my chicken Parmesan when I went this weekend. The manager and the waiter were more then willing to make my visit better and to help fix the situation. My girlfriend both ordered cheesecake for dessert, which we both found to be very delicious. I would still recommend this particular Cheesecake Factory.

The only thing i can say is that they have a great brunch! But sadly,  i am done! I will no longer eat here after 6 pm! Your food rushed, poor waiter service forgetting things. I come to the conclusion  that they place you in darkness so you don&#39;t see the horrible display of your food! Over rated! 2020 no longer giving my money to any restaurants  that have nasty, i dont care food, we just want the money! They charge 20 for a  chicken club (burnt bacon)  sandwich thats really a tomato sandwich! My sister cold fries! Squeeze you at a table to the point that the couple sitting next to you has to place their behind in your  plate to get up! This place is a disgrace!
Dirty plates (there was literally a piece of old food stuck to my plate and fork), no napkins, cold bread and slow service (took 25 mins to check out). Very disappointing experience on 1/1/2020.

My husband and I ate at The Cheesecake Factory in Fort Lauderdale over a decade ago and it was such a great meal! We&#39;ve wanted to go back to a location near us, but the closest one is this one in Willow Grove which is almost an hour away. We finally had the opportunity to go there as we happened to be in the area this Sunday. What a difference from Florida. First off, it is way too DARK in there!! Tables are WAY too close together, the couple next to us felt as if they were WITH us. The bread was good. My drink was very good, but our food arrived after a very long wait. My truffle-honey chicken had no honey or truffle anything, it was plain fried chicken with no additional flavorings of any kind. The asparagus was tough and under-cooked. The mashed potatoes were delicious. My husband&#39;s pasta with vegetables was so very very bland, even after adding salt and much pepper from containers that were clogged up. Yes, the cheesecake was great. Traveling to another Cheesecake Factory is now off our &#34;bucket list&#34; and we will not return. I&#39;m just glad we didn&#39;t make a special trip just to go there. I can get a better, cheaper, more flavorful meal at a diner.

This place is sucks, I understand you could having a bad day but that is not give you the right to try people bad if the girl who was attending doesn&#39;t like her work just quit your job sweet, I bought a cake three cakes actually she was mad because no body was helping her and everyone we had to see who she complained about it. And the end she jus gave two cakes

We went to this restaurant on a Friday night. Of course busy. We waited for about an hour before we were seated.  We met our waitress and she introduced herself. We ordered our appetizers , food and drinks at that time we were starving.  Our buffalo blast did not arrive until about an 1 hr.    And when they did arrive - the waitress immediately  came over to apologize.  She said she spoke with her manager and mentioned that we waited a long time for our appetizers. She came and sat beside me which i did appreciate. Since we waited so long, the manager said we could take the appetizers off the bill or 2 cheese cake desserts.   We chose the desserts. Our dinner did arrived shortly after.  Presentation of our food was good and the food tasted delicious.  I did order a margarita. The taste was good but sadly the glass was small and with the ice- there was not much to drink. <br>Once we were done - we asked for the check- and our waitress said ther the buffalo blast were taken off the bill. <br> It was a win win for us. Thank you cheese cake factory for being aware of your customers <br>I will cont to go to this restaurant. <br>I gave it 4 stars- we waited 1 hr  before being seated and 1 hr for our appetizers.

Came for a birthday brunch for my dad. We all had their lunch specials. The lunch specials are until 5pm everyday which is awesome. You get to save a couple bucks from their regular prices. The portion of the food are the same as regular price. Food was amazing and they had good service.

Customer service was great. However, after getting my food not so much. I order the burger stuff with cheese. I had a burger with cheese oozed out before I had a chance to bite into it. And the burger/patty is burnt, all I tasted was charcoal. I will attach a photo. Really disappointed! Why serve a burnt burger, just make a new one. Really sad.

Usually this location is extremely crowded, but my fiance and I went at a time where it was RIGHT before Dinner on Sunday night. We were seated within five minutes which was great! Only downside, we got those really small tables that are RIGHT within earshot of other tables that are RIGHT next to you, so I could hear the couple next to me&#39;s entire conversation, and I had couples on either side of me. The table is also a little small to accommodate bread, an appetizer, and an entree, so plates need to be cleared first (which our waitress was pretty good about). I loved the honey wheat bread, I could devour the entire thing (which I did, because my fiance only likes the white bread haha!) We got the fried macaroni and cheese bites as an appetizer which was delicious! It said it came with marinara sauce, but it was more so a vodka sauce, and just lightly on the bottom of the plate, not like an actual dipping sauce like I thought it would be. I got the Parmesan crusted chicken with green beans and mashed potatoes and my meal was so delicious! It comes with 3 small breasts and I could only eat one. I saved the rest for Lunch the next day (and gave my Mom one of the breasts) and I was STILL full the next day! I wish I had room for cheesecake, they have sooo many cheesecake flavors to choose from!!! The cheesecake slices are expensive, but worth it if you&#39;re sharing with someone, or eating it in multiple sittings.

I&#39;ve only been to TCF twice in all my life, the first time was at the KOP location and the second time was at the Willow Grove location. <br><br>The hostess was friendly but seemed confused and disorganized. We were sat within ten minutes of arriving. Our server was polite, funny, patient, and knew his stuff. Our drinks were always filled and our appetizers and main course arrived in a timely manner. <br><br>The food was average, very large quantity - enough for lunch, dinner, and tomorrow&#39;s lunch, but not high quality for the price.

Food was amazing! We went yesterday for Valentine&#39;s Day. This tall server offered to pack up my pasta when I got home I found not one but a BUNCH of white hairs in it which I&#39;m confused because I didn&#39;t have hairs in it before and my server was a tall kind slim African American guy I&#39;m so turned off by the hairs I won&#39;t return ever again! Sad because that&#39;s my favorite spot and go to for holidays or celebrations I&#39;m so disgusted  and disappointed !i should&#39;ve known better because my menu had a lot of food and sticky stuff on it which I did mention to him when he first took our order
Service was slow and my main course was over cooked rubber shrimp and over cooked pasta is never good. Frist time here at a cheesecake factory and have to say not impressed.

Wow......our experience here was pretty dreadful.  Where do I begin?  Well, let&#39;s start with a positive or two; the tex-mex eggrolls appetizer was really good.  My wife said that the Chicken and biscuits dinner was pretty good.  The Chicken Teriyaki I had was okay at best, pretty dry and not much in terms of teriyaki sauce.<br><br>Now for the other side.....we had to wait a LONG time for our dinners.  How long?  A family of four on one side of us, who came in 20 minutes after us, had received their appetizer and entrees before us.  We were fine with the wait until we saw that.  The waitress gave a lot of attention to the two tables on either side of us, but we must have been on the &#34;pay-no-mind list&#34; (thanks to Joe Pesci for that one!).  The noise level was unacceptable and the music obnoxious.<br><br>What bothered me most of all was that this was where my wife wanted to go for her birthday dinner and I feel like she was cheated out of what should have been a better experience.<br><br>From what I&#39;ve seen from other critical reviews here, the management will give some lame, insincere reply -- so please save that.  It will only make me physically ill.  Do me at least that favor.

I&#39;m only giving it 3 stars because you really have to know the menu to order something you enjoy. Don&#39;t get me wrong, I come here pretty often. I came here for brunch just today in fact. I always order something I never had from the menu but I&#39;m usually disappointed. It seems I have to stick with only what I already know. I&#39;ve had so much on the menu too. My favorite entrees are the miso salmon and filet mignon. As for appetizers, I love the stuffed mushrooms, I like some of the egg rolls and a few of their salads. The cheesecakes are obviously DELICIOUS. My favorite is the original. I tried probably 15 different varieties by now. I personally think the burgers and fries are sub par. Nothing special. But like I mentioned, they have an extensive menu and I&#39;m sure if you go here you&#39;ll find something you like, it just might take a while.

Absolutely terrible tonight! We arrived around 4:30 after doing some shopping. We waited about 10-15 minutes which isn&#39;t bad for this place. It tends to get very crowded. We were sat just outside the main restaurant. When we being sat the table was still dirty from the previous guests. It was also very loud and very cold in that section.<br><br>We ordered drinks and dinner at the same time. We waited a bit for the server to greet us. This was by far the worst service we&#39;ve had in a long time. The girl didn&#39;t tell us her name, she was very flat and unenthusiastic to say the least. Our daughter ordered an orange juice, literally took 25 minutes to get it. We had to ask twice, we were told it&#39;s fresh squeezed so it takes a while. We had TJ ask for bread, didn&#39;t receive lemons in water or tea (we did ask). Worst of all was the wait time for food. With no exaggeration it took an hour for our food. Tables that were sat after us were eating before us. I understand a restaurant can get busy and things happen. The main issue is the server made no attempt to inform us as to what was going on. She was honestly one of the worst servers we&#39;ve ever had. She didn&#39;t seem to care a bit.<br><br>The manager did bring our food out personally and apologized. She then came over again after the meal and asked how everything was. The food was good but there is no reason for 2 entrees to take an hour. She offered us free dessert and we declined. She then took of one of our meals. It was a nice gesture but it was too late. We left very unhappy. Not sure if we will return. 1 star
I had the Ahi Tuna Tartare. Fantastic. If it&#39;s too crowded, grab a seat at the bar. Kristin is an awesome bar waitress.

Have to say for the amount of money I paid for dinner tonight I&#39;m beyond fed up, quality of food has seriously degraded here! I ordered the steak diane rare with mash potatoes, and was thoroughly disgusted with the meal. Steak was overcooked, dry, and like chewing on boot leather, the potatoes seriously nastier then the steak. They were so dry, crumbly, and cold like they were a few days old. I wish I was one of those people who complained and got  my money back,  but I didn&#39;t I&#39;ll just take my business elsewhere. My server Javier was definitely the only 5 star in that place!

I honestly want to know WTF WAS OUR WAITRESS&#39; PROBLEM?! <br><br>Before I begin, I just want to say that I remember our waitress&#39; name very well, but I have chosen to omit it from this post because she clearly has enough issues. <br><br>My mom and I went to the Cheesecake Factory in Willow Grove. We&#39;ve frequented this specific location many times and never had an issue. Our waitress wasn&#39;t particularly friendly from the start, just lackluster. <br><br>First, there was A HAIR in our appetizer. The manager came over, apologized, and brought us another appetizer to go. Our waitress did not apologize. Fine. Whatever. <br><br>We got our entrees. I asked for bacon on my sandwich twice while ordering. Did I get bacon? No. Our waitress claimed she didn&#39;t hear me. Fine. I told her it was ok, I just didn&#39;t want to be charged for something I didn&#39;t receive. <br><br>During her down time, our waitress sat two tables away from us wrapping silverware in cloth napkins as we ate. I could clearly see her. I felt like she was glaring over at us with a pissy look on her face. Or maybe she had a severe case of RBF. ‍<br><br>We weren&#39;t even halfway done eating when our waitress SLAMMED our check on the table, said nothing and sprinted away. No &#34;would you like anything else?&#34; &#34;Would you like dessert?&#34; Not even &#34;I&#39;ll leave this here and take it when you&#39;re ready.&#34; Her actions said &#34;pay and get out.&#34; My mom and I were looking at each other like &#34;did that just happen?&#34; <br><br>A few minutes later, she SNATCHED one of our empty bowls off the table. She yanked it with such force that she actually startled my mom.<br><br>At this point, I lost my appetite and my mom lost her patience. We asked a different waiter to get the manager. The manager came over and my mom explained what happened. Suddenly our waitress appeared with one of our to-go orders and my mom, being an OG, flat out asked her IN FRONT OF HER MANAGER &#34;why did you slam this check down?&#34; Visually shocked and annoyed, she darted away in a huff. The manager said &#34;that&#39;s ok, I wanted her to walk away. You don&#39;t have to have that conversation with her, I will.&#34; And the manager finished waiting on us for the brief remainder of our time there. <br><br>Also our waitress continued rolling silverware and peering pissily at us. <br><br>Out of our appetizer, two entrees, two to-go entrees, and two cheesecakes, the only thing that was taken off our bill was the appetizer.<br><br>I felt very uncomfortable and wanted to leave. I understand working for the public is difficult. There could have been some misunderstanding or something taken the wrong way. Or any number of things could have happened before she got to us or in her personal life, but you CAN NOT take your anger out on other people. She ruined an otherwise great evening.<br><br>In any other instance this situation would have received 1 star, but I&#39;ve been here so many times in the past and had great service that I couldn&#39;t do it. I was actually apprehensive about posting this for the same reason, but it was such an unpleasant experience that I had to post it. The (hairless) food was still really good. And while this one waitress was a sour apple, she did not spoil the whole bunch. I&#39;ll more than likely return, but I hope I never get her as a waitress again.

Food quality has gone down, prices have gone up. Skip this place. Very noisy , tables crowded against each other.  You hear every word of the conversation of the table next to you.<br>Not enjoyable. <br>Just say no.

Great experience yesterday! Delicious food and our waitress was on point. I reviewed this as a 4 because it was entirely to dark, patrons were using the phone flashlights to read things on the menu and check. Just brighten it up a tad more. Also, would you consider having a sampler cheesecake plate of the consumers choice? Would be great when wanting to try a few flavors.

I tried the Cheesecake Factory one more time, same dish, Chicken Madeira, and it was worse than the first time. The dish is called Chicken Madeira for a reason. Because the mushrooms are sautéed with the Madeira wine sauce and poured over the chicken. NOT ONE TASTE OF MADEIRA SAUCE.  The mashed potatoes were so dry I couldn&#39;t eat them. Another $25 down the drain. I&#39;m so disappointed. I called the kitchen and spoke to the manager and he said &#34;call DoorDash and tell them, we don&#39;t deal with complaints. I was floored. I think I&#39;m done.
Food was a little blah this time. The section we sat in was extremely warm and the floor was really slippery.
went here tonight and had the best waiter! i think his name was brandon and he was so pleasant and friendly. great food and cheesecake as usual!

Excellent service. The food amazing. Management was very active. My plate took a little longer and when the waitress came the manager was as a back up that was not needed since I am not a drama lol. But overall 5 stars for my first visit at the place. Will come back !!!!

Dined in Sunday night 2/10/19<br>Seated around 7 PM and didn&#39;t leave until 8:52 PM<br>Server: Geraldine <br>Manager: Bryan or Ryan (didn&#39;t hear what he said clearly)<br><br>*Skip to the last paragraph for the best part of this all*<br><br>I want to start out by saying that I LOVE The Cheesecake Factory. This wasn&#39;t our first time, so we know the drill here. I have also been a server for three different restaurants, so again, I know the drill. <br><br>We waited about 35 mins to be seated, but that&#39;s expected here. Once we were seated, our server, Geraldine, came to say she&#39;ll be right back. 20 minutes later she finally came back, didn&#39;t introduce herself and then took our order. We got 3 apps, the first came after 20 minutes. 15 minutes later we were still waiting for our two other apps. They finally came and we&#39;re good. We finished our apps around 8 (at this point I was paying close attention to the time. <br><br>8:30 our food finally comes. My cheese was crusty on the burger, the onions were shriveled and there were two random sauces on the burger. There should have only been one sauce. I ordered sweet potato fries and got regular, AND they were cold. We sat for about 10 minutes waiting for Geraldine to come check on us. Meanwhile my boyfriends burger was getting cold. By the way, his was missing sauce and he didn&#39;t get a sauce on the side he asked for. She finally came and I asked for the manager. He came, and handled the situation really well. Although I wish I could say he saved the night, after 2 hours there, our night was disappointing. His name was Bryan or Ryan (not 100% sure what he said). So he brings us the check and we wait for Geraldine to come grab it. Once again we were waiting for 10 minutes and finally just got up to YET AGAIN find the manager to complete our payment. We could have just not paid and left. It didn&#39;t seem like Geraldine would have even known.<br><br>I want to add that both tables surrounding us had a problem with their service as well. Table to our left hadn&#39;t gotten drinks for a good 30 minutes and the table to the right didn&#39;t get their cheesecakes for at least 35 minutes. I don&#39;t know if Geraldine was having a bad night or what, but I wasn&#39;t paying $100.00+ for this kind of service. I really got the impression that she was newer and was getting flustered and overwhelmed. Although it was 7:30 on a Sunday.. <br><br>All in all, service was terrible and it seemed the kitchen was off too with all the odd sauces or lack thereof I should say. I would definitely prefer to go to the KOP location next time.<br><br>After we finished our first appetizer, we wanted to make room on the table for the next two apps. When Geraldine came to drop off the two plates I asked her if she could take the empty plate (which was sitting there. Ever heard of pre-bussing?) from the first appetizer to make room. She took the tray and started walking away, then turned around and I kid you not she said to my boyfriend &#34;Wait actually can you hold this while I get something for them?&#34;. I promise you she handed the plate BACK to my boyfriend and she walked to another table to give them &#34;something&#34;. The kicker? SHE NEVER CAME BACK FOR THAT PLATE! My boyfriend sat there holding the plate and just looked at me in shock. I was also speechless. I still am!

Zero stars. If I could give this zero stars I would. First time here at this location and it will be our last! We arrived around 10:30am today (Sunday). They opened at 10. There were people dining. My husband and l got seated in a section that was outside in the mall. Separated from the mall by fake plants. (We were the only people sitting in this area). We waited for 10 minutes and no one came to our table. Other people/groups were getting seated inside after us, were waited on etc and we were never acknowledged. The people dining at your restaurant should never have to get up and find a server. Unacceptable. We got up and left.

ATTN WILLOW GROVE CHEESECAKE MGMT:<br><br>Take Marisa F.&#39;s recent review with several grains of salt. She has a history of credibility issues regarding her reviews. The prevalence of one-star evaluations in her profile greatly attests to that.<br><br>If you don&#39;t believe me, check out her review of Isaac Newton&#39;s in Newtown. Yes?<br><br>I&#39;ve been following this development since early January. My findings are iron-clad. <br><br>Yours,<br><br>Det. Mitch Cumstein

Why do I get sick every time I eat here?<br>They are putting something extra in the food.<br>I went last weekend and sat at the Bar and had the Jamacain Jumbolia or whatever its called.  <br><br>I wonder if i&#39;m the only one getting sick because this place stays packed.<br>I was lucky to find bar seats.  The entire time people were standing behind us like it was a fkn club.  This is the last time i go to CCF.

This dinner was spectacular, Ian C was such a great server. He helped me and my husband out a lot when it came to what meal we should get. He suggested the truffle fried chicken, It was so delicious. Definitely going there next time and Ian is our guy

Went to Cheesecake Factory for a Saturday Birthday brunch in February. Ordered cheese quesadilla which came with brown guacamole. Notified the manager and Cheesecake Factory customers service on Facebook messenger and no one did anything. <br><br>All I got was an excuse staying that guacamole oxidized. Mind you the meal was served at 11:30ish in the AM. The general manager of the store said &#34;sorry&#34; on the phone and stayed silent for the rest of the time.<br><br>I have been a customer for years and the way the willow grove location treated this situation is unacceptable. I gave them a chance to make this right and no one made an effort. Should of posted this the same day. <br><br>If you want a good fresh meal Cheesecake Factory in willow grove is not the place for that.
Love this place. Always crowded. Salads and chicken parm are top choices. For being a chain spot. Prices are a bit high. It is not fancy but it very nice.

So came to the Philly location a few weeks back. found hair fried into the calamari. The rice in my food and my friends food was old and or undercooked. Was sick for two days and they send me 50$? How about you try and pay for the whole meal not a portion? Cheap asses...  No respect for the food they serve their customers...

Cheese cake was really good! They have a wide variety of options and they have a skinny licious menu as well. I love the buffalo blasts and almost any dessert! I would definitely recommend it to a friend.

The food was decent, however we had 6 people at our table each of us received our food separately. Not a minute or two more like 4-5 minutes apart. The portions don&#39;t really match their prices. The curry platter was unusually sweet.

Time and time again, I have come out to this Cheesecake Factory. I have also been to the one in center city, but the service and food here is unbeatable. I have never once had bad service nor received anything less than great food. My favorite dish is the Louisiana chicken pasta. Next to that would be the chicken lettuce wraps. Any chocolate cheesecake does well for dessert, but my favorite is the Godiva chocolate cheesecake. The price is a bit high, but portions are large, so it is worth the price you pay. I never tried the drinks, but may do so in the future.

Not bad<br><br>I took my wife out early to beat the mother&#39;s day rush next weekend. Well we didn&#39;t know what to expect as far as their menu since we only have been getting over the years cheesecake from this place. <br><br>Anyway we had a great server named Rachael. She was attentive, helpful, and had a great attitude. <br><br>I ordered the lemon-herb roasted chicken and it was delicious, moist, flavorful and the carrots that came with it were good. The mashed potatoes was the only let down for me. They were dry and crumbly which was a disappointment to be honest. <br><br>My wife ordered the Thai-coconut lime chicken and she loved it and had enough for later on at home. <br><br>All in all a great experience and we are looking forward to coming back.

This Cheesecake Factory in specific is my go-to whenever I have no idea what I want to eat because this place has everything! It has yet to fail me. <br><br>My favorite is the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. Amazing! The portions are huge, but I still finish it. I usually don&#39;t have room for cheesecake, but... I get it anyways. There&#39;s always room for dessert because dessert doesn&#39;t go to the stomach, it goes to the heart.

The Cheesecake Factory has always been a great family restaurant and I haven&#39;t really ever had a bad experience at this chain. So most Cheesecake Factory restaurants all have pretty much the same decor and the menu is pretty standard. So my wife and I decided to come in this past weekend and as usual the service and food was excellent. We ended up ordering off the skinny menu for my wife and I are both trying to watch what we eat and ended up getting the filet steak and the chicken pasta which were both great and shared the artichoke crab dip which I must say was good but a lot smaller than I remembered. Anyhow we also ended up getting the Godiva chocolate brownie sundae which was great as well. Overall this location is usually packed, however it&#39;s service and food is the classic Cheesecake Factory signature service and quality. I had no complaints and look forward to coming back.

Came in Sunday around 3:15, seated by 3:39. Lemon water didn&#39;t have lemon. Water glasses could use some detailed cleaning. Milk cup for my coffee wasn&#39;t washed out of some caramel that was in there before. Food came out within reasonable time, food was okay. The menu has plenty meals to choose from. Hibachi steak ordered medium rare was cooked to order. Overall the experience was okay but not the best.

My family I went to the Willow Grove location for brunch and arrived a little after opening. We had a vety attentive waiter, Lexi (I believe her full name on the receipt was Alexis).<br><br>Lexi was very attentive and accommodating to my mother who&#39;s English isn&#39;t that great and can want things last minute. She was always at our table with a smile on her face.<br><br>The food was great. I ordered the Macaroni and Cheese burger. My mom ordered the Steak Diane, and my brother ordered the fish tacos.<br><br>We always underestimate the portion size of the food. You will never leave this place hungry even if you just order a regular entrée.<br><br>We had a wonderful time and Lexi definitely made it special.

The decor is fun, the place is large (and loud), and the food is decent for a chain restaurant. I do not like how they pack you in like sardines at the 2 and 4 top tables. The menu is huge and somewhat overwhelming. There is a separate &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu if you are looking for the healthier options. <br><br>There are some fabulous looking salads and, of course, an insane dessert selection, but I opted for the grilled fish tacos this time. The corn tortillas were nicely grilled and filled with slaw, grilled fish, pico de gallo and fresh avocado. The dish was accompanied by lime cilantro rice and black beans. The rice and beans were both tasty, but the rice was a bit greasy.<br><br>My daughter got a chicken Caesar salad and shrimp scampi minus tomatoes. The salad was good. The dressing is garlicky but not bad for bottled Caesar. The shrimp in the scampi dish was breaded and the sauce creamy, which are atypical of traditional scampi. It was also very garlicky. Portions are huge!!<br><br>I liked that the server asked if there were any food allergies (apparently they change gloves if so). I also enjoyed watching the screen with all the photos of the dishes, so I could narrow it down for next time :)

Worst experiences I&#39;ve ever had at a cheesecake factory. I was with my husband and my one year-old son and it took over an hour and a half for me to get my entrée. My husband and my son had to leave because he&#39;s one and can&#39;t sit through an hour and a half dinner. This was in between the The lunch and dinner hours so it should not of been that busy. In addition to that my appetizer which was a beat and go cheese salad was very small and the arugula was completely wilted and in edible. I ended up having to get my entrée to go and was not even offered to be compensated for the long wait. I am not going back to this cheesecake factory anytime soon.

TCF is usually my favorite chain restaurant. But my recent experience at TCF Willow Grove was a bit...lacking. The wait wasn&#39;t as bad as I was expecting. I think their whole refusal to take reservations is a bit ridiculous, mostly because it really inhibits the ability to plan a nice evening out. Anyway, it was a bit dirty inside. We had to request the table to be wiped down. There was an odd stale smell in the air too. <br><br>Usually the bread just comes, but we were asked if we wanted it - which I thought was odd. I&#39;m used to it just being there. We order a couple of appetizers and our meals. Then I ordered an apple cider. I got an apple juice and i was like hey I wanted a cider and our waiter was like ok that&#39;s what we call our apple juice. Nice try. Is this my first time ordering an apple cider? Am I an 8 year old?<br><br>We eat the rest of the meal. It was delicious. The kitchen never disappoints. My MIL (who has quite discerning taste) was impressed. <br><br>Then the bill came and the apple juice was on it. Note it was called &#34;juice&#34; on the bill not &#34;cider&#34;. Oh and speaking of the bill, they put misleading tip percentages on the bill. They are supposed to base the tip on the pre-tax amount, but they base it on the post tax amount. Shady. They took off the juice and claimed it was an accident that it was still on it in the first place. Shady. I had the celebration cheesecake. I wouldn&#39;t get it again. Should have went with the 30th anniversary one instead. Oh and they need to bring back the Navajo and the apple pie cheescake.

When you first come in, the atmosphere is great. Nice and vibrant. However, when I sat down I learned never to judge a book by its cover.<br><br>I ordered the factory burger, and had to wait a decent amount of time to get it. When it arrived, I was disappointed.<br><br>I ordered it medium rare, and it was like a piece of charcoal, look and taste-wise. Overcooked and no flavor whatsoever. The fries were DELICIOUS though so that&#39;s why I&#39;m giving it 2 stars.

For once I hear report that these are professional people with excellent customer service friendly atmosphere and very very good steak and potatoes and nothing mention the cheesecake ohmygod it&#39;s actually went the waiters are very very nice and friendly people persons and this is an excellent model as to what to be like a restaurant because I&#39;ve had share had nightmares and others very clean restaurant service is fast and friendly

Besides the 40 min wait to be seated the food was good I was stuffed , I went with the Steak tips , Shrimp scampi the bill came to but $100 bucks I also had 2 drinks with 2kids meal and another adult meal , not bad !!

Always great service and extensive menu. Menu is labeled if an item has gluten in it. I love their Cobb salad! Very accommodating of my gluten allergy but they do not have gluten free bread but serve regular bread on the table before food comes - this has happened to me about 3 times now. This is frustrating for someone who has a gluten allergy!

The food is always pretty good, and I especially like the bread that they give you. Today, my chicken maidera was awesome.  My waitress was also really nice, but It did take her quite a long time to take our orders, bring our drinks out, bring bread out, bring the check, etc. I feel like they need more waitstaff there because there always seems to be hold ups. Other than that, the food and ambiance is good.

This is my &#34;pre-review&#34; before I go for dinner tonight to treat my friend for her birthday.   The recent reviews here concern me, and what seems worse is the somewhat nonchalant canned reply from management &#34;we&#39;re sorry and hope you will give us another chance&#34;, when the response should be to contact the manager directly to get a better resolution.  Some of these experiences and pictures of the food posted, as well as descriptions of poor treatment that were specific enough to believe, have me worried about my visit.   <br><br>In anticipation of a good meal tonight, I have put five stars and plan to come back and update my review after our dinner tonight.   Five stars is because that&#39;s been my experience previously.  We come to this location a couple times a year when we meet for dinner, and we have loved the food and have had great service.  We get there early on a weeknight (5:30), and it&#39;s not overly crowded, and everything has always been great.  The chicken maderia that we usually split is our favorite and is absolutely amazing.  We have not experienced overdone, underdone, rude behavior, or long waits for food or our check.   <br><br>I sure hope that things haven&#39;t changed since I was there a few months ago.   The reviews I am reading are very detrimental and worrisome.  I don&#39;t run to Yelp and write a bad review over one small disappointment, but the bad reviews here certainly seem to have some merit.   My optimistic switch is &#34;on&#34;, and I look forward to treating my friend to a lovely, stress-free birthday dinner tonight.   Cheesecake Factory, I have faith in you.....don&#39;t make me come back and change my review!!!
Love the happy hour menu.  The pork belly sliders and southern fried chicken sliders are one of the best. The server Joe was very pleasant and very helpful.

Before we left I decided to buy some cheesecake slices to bring home for my family. I had decided that I wanted the Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake and the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake. I checked the pricing for them on the price board before I got to the register and it was : $7.50 for the Strawberry and $8.50 for the Godiva. I added it up and totaled it to be $16, so I took out $17 thinking it would be more than enough. I was waiting for quite a bit but didn&#39;t really mind because there was a group before me being served. However, when the WHITE lady was done helping the group she walked to the register and said &#34;what do you want?&#34; No smile, no hello, no friendly voice. I responded very politely and friendly asking for those two flavors. She said &#34;your total is $18.50.&#34; So I had to pull two more dollars out thinking how was it this much for two pieces of cheesecake... fast forward I&#39;m waiting and then FINALLY she just hands me my order and says &#34;here you go.&#34; At this point I was like wow I get overcharged for two cheesecakes and crappy service. ALSO I did NOT get a receipt from her so I&#39;m still trying to figure out how it costed that much!!! After having such a good dinner service, I did not expect to leave this unhappy.

The cheesecake is good, but everything else tastes so processed. I&#39;m not into chains in general, but this used to be an exception. No longer, even the salad tasted chemical/processed. I will still get my daughter a piece of cheesecake for her birthday once a year, but we are done with it otherwise.
I love how there are so many options to choose from! The menu offers such a variety of dishes! I personally love the Thai lettuce wraps, fried macaroni balls and of course the desserts!

CF is always the same to me. There has never been a time that I went and disliked anything. The ambiance is always nice and the smell is pleasant.<br><br>I ordered the Jamaican black pepper shrimp. I at every single bit the flavor was amazing. I did not like the black beans so much but the shrimp,chicken and that tasty mango salsa  all disappeared lol. <br><br>The Georgia peach is my favorite drink there. It&#39;s a pretty fruity frozen drink. Very tasty if I must say so myself. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory on many occasions and I think I&#39;ve actually had a cheesecake twice. They are good and really big. Two people could share one. There are so many to choose from. <br><br>Takeaways: the wait for a table is always super long. The bar area is open seating but it is usually always full but you can order the full menu there. The menu is way to long. It such a large variety of food and the menu is about 10 pages it sometimes takes me a while to order. <br><br>In my opinion the wait is worth it and the large menu gives you different things to try each time. So check it out.

I came here with family. We all ordered from the regular menu. The portions are huge. The food was fresh and did not take that long. The server was very nice. The music was kind of loud but I guess that may be because it is not that crowded. My sandwich was okay but may have been a little better if the shrimp were not slightly over cooked. I also got the banana cream cheese cake. It was very good and not overly sweet.

Ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, which is what I usually get. It is a little spicy but this time it was so spicy I had to send it back. I then ordered the Margherita Pizza and this came out way overdone. Luckily they did not charge us for either. Poor service and quality of food.

Terrible service I came here for my 27th birthday and multiple  parties were sat before us. Not to mention the host at the front was very rude and had a complete  attitude.  Sad thing was this was on a Wednesday. Very disappointed because I like the cheesecake  factory in general

EDIT: took a star off after our last experience. Saturday is understandingly busy but tonight was outrageous. The people who run this location need more training. My date and I were escorted to a table that was already full of people and we just stood there like deer in headlights.. went back to the hostess desk and no one knew what was going on or what table was actually clear or not. Eventually they found a table for us. But that&#39;s where hell began. Why would anyone seat a quiet couple shoved in a corner next to the most obnoxious group of college freshmen laughing screaming the entire time...  <br>can&#39;t speak for the food because I packed it to go to finish it at home in peace and quiet. And then lost my appetite all together... awful experience. No apology from the server. <br><br>I have &#34;Duchess&#34; status at this particular location so I&#39;ve been here MANY times and for the most part the food is excellent. Tonight&#39;s experience This time we were seated in the area outside the restaurant, and I don&#39;t mean the outdoor seating. But the tables that line the entrance to the mall. Yes, we were seated by the mall doors. To say this was insulting does not even begin to describe it. If I wanted to sit in a food court while listen to screaming children and other people running out of the mall shaking the ground I would have went there to eat. Instead I came to the Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday night for a restaurant experience. There is no music in this section, and the servers even seem to forget there are people that need to be waited on out here.

BEWARE, do not pay with a credit card at this restaurant. Twice now I did not get my credit card back. The last time I told the waitress I didn&#39;t get it back. She swore she gave it to me. So I emptied the contents of my wallet and pockets numerous times while my family members searched under the table. The waitress came back with it and told me the manager had it. Next day my phone goes crazy with credit alerts. I called the credit company and found that my address was changed. There was a $500 purchase at Nordstrom and a $1,500 laptop purchased. I called Cheesecake Factory and was told all the managers were in a meeting and could not talk. I left my number but no one called back. I then went on the Cheescake website and went through the &#39;contact us&#39; link. I left a detailed description of my experience and never received a reply. So now I warn everyone about this place. Shame because this was a regular go-to place for us. Not anymore!

The service is subpar, and equally the food. I have visited numerous times and each time the experience has been substandard (not insane, just have been invited for gatherings). The waiters are not equally attentive and the food is overcooked with little flavor. The prices aren&#39;t justified considering quality of food.
