I will staunchly avoid going to this restaurant and will not suggest others to dine here. Not only had I had bad experiences but others had grievances as well.

Food is great. They&#39;re usually really busy so service can be a little slow, but the staff is always friendly. I had the romano crusted chicken for dinner and it was amazing. My bf had the orange chicken and he loved it. Our servings were huge so we ended up taking our meals home. Our apps, fried mac and cheese balls and fried mozzarella were delicious. Of course we each got a slice of cheesecake. I had the chocolate tuxedo cheesecake and my bf had the lemon raspberry cheesecake. Both were so good. Prices can be a little high but it&#39;s worth it.

Really bad. After being seated quickly at an outside table some 15 minutes passed to be noticed and have a waiter assigned. Once we ordered it was nearly an hour before, and after being assured by the polite waiter that our entrees were in production. We  then complained to a passing manager.  The manager returned to report nacho chips were the hold up. He then disagreed that our wait was extraordinarily long. Then three of four items arrived, the chips were down and came even later. Sadly, the entrees wilted under a heat lamp and arrived tired.<br><br>$ 86,00 later the manager ducked away from me in the restroom. We voiced our complaint with both the waiter and manager. As we were preparing to leave the same waiter was apologizing to another table of customers for the long wait.  We did enjoy watching the sunset over the bread we requested twice.  A really bad night at the Willow Grove Cheesecake Factory. Two hours and forty minutes peppered by rude treatment from the managing staff.  Not the Redondo Beach Cheesecake Factory by any means.<br><br>I too am in customer service. The manager had an opportunity to address such poor service when he responded to my complaint. His response was to disagree and let us know the kitchen was out of chips. He had a second opportunity when I was leaving, rather slowly using a walker. He had a third chance when my daughter returned to retrieve her lost purse. It&#39;s nice you will talk to staff, you had a chance to talk to our table of four. Your manager needs retraining and using my didactic review is a bargain for you.  <br><br>I see lots of guest services replies on YELP, I also see lots of disappointed customers.

Food was good, the rest was not. We were seated at a very dirty table. We asked to be moved. Service was slow. Our food arrived at different times. Our server was nice but clueless. They sat another family at the first, dirty table we were seated at without cleaning. We looked for management so we could bring this to someone&#39;s attention, but none could be found. We will not be returning.

I&#39;m not one to generally write a review of my experiences and will over look many discomforts and poor service.  However my experience at the Willow Grove, Pa location can not go unmentioned.  The manager on duty was by far the most disrespectful individual I&#39;ve ever met.  My family and I decided to have an evening out together and visited this location.  During our meal a storm developed and the roof leaked right on top of our table and the table behind us.  After reporting this the manager made every attempt to avoid making any contact with us and gave the impression of so what.  Water dripping on our food and bodies and ruin a family night out.  Date of incident 7/11/19.  This manager needs sensitivity training.  Willing to provide it.

I recently went to the Cheesecake Factory yesterday night for take out. I wasn&#39;t sure what I wanted but the person taking my order named Carmela was so patient and sweet. I asked what her favorites were, which she suggested a few dishes. I know it can be a pain handling a customer who doesn&#39;t know what they want but she made my short experience very enjoyable. Thank you Carmela!

Ordered through Door Dash and had my food delivered. The door dash driver was great and on time. The take out food from Cheesecake Factory sucked. I have eaten many times in the restaurant without complaint. Ordered the Thai Lettuce Wraps and there was barley any chicken and it was packaged poorly. The margarita flat bread pizza was just awful. Looked and tasted like it was thrown in a microwave. Also got a coke and dr. pepper.  Must have been poured an hour ago it was watered down. Not happy.

Go to another location . I had a bug in my cheesecake and when I called to complain the Manager Lakeisha I think she said her  name was had a cavalier attitude about it <br><br>Update... 1/12/18 (late update) <br>1. I did get in contact with a representative from corporate after they read my review He was very helpful and even compensated me for my trouble  with a $25 gift card I was able to get into more detail about my experience . I hope the manager has since received more training  or has found a new job that is not in the hospitality/customer service field

Wow. This place sure knows how to disappoint. The food is so bland. My boyfriend and I ordered 2 apps, 1 entree each, a root beer, and a mai tai. <br><br>The apps were decent, I guess. We got the calamari and the portabella mushroom, avocado and zucchini fries. Both were breaded in the same fashion and both of them has a rather smoky (not in a good way but like they re-used the oil a few times too many) flavor. <br><br>My boyfriend got a kobe burger and it was big but bland. No flavor. He asked for a medium rare and it came out rare. He would&#39;ve ordered a steak if he wanted rare. The fries were also terrible. How do you mess up on french fries? I got a dish that is supposedly &#34;shepherd&#39;s pie&#34; but it was definitely not. It was just patty meat chopped up in gravy with mash on top. Disappointing. <br><br>The only reason why I even gave a star was because the waitress was so sweet. But I came here for food not to make a friend. <br><br>I will not be coming back unless if I&#39;m there to pick up some dessert. You&#39;ll probably find me at the food court because at least I know what I&#39;m getting and that it&#39;ll actually have some flavor.

Service was horrible, we came in at 5:29 and was not greeted by our server Kaleena until 5:45. Everything took forever to come out, EVEN WATER! She was not attentive to the point the ice melted in our cups. She&#39;s at a five top next to us just talking and walks past us and and a 2 top that was just sat. Spoke to the manager and he never offered anything to console us, he just said okay! We come here often and this is by far the worst experience and has changed my view on the restaurant

Unfortunately  upon arrival we sat for quite a while. Many servers passed us and looked at us but no one stopped to ask if we were being helped. Finally we had to stop someone and ask for our server.  When he came over he stated that no one told him we were there, which I don&#39;t doubt,  and he was VERY apologetic. We were very disappointed because we were there to celebrate my daughter&#39;s graduation and family came from across town to join us.
The wait is long. The staff hardly pays attention to their tables. And make sure you get your credit card back and you d ok not have additional charges the days after your visit.

This place keep getting trashier. I took my dad out for dinner the server was extremely rude he did not even give his name and the food was complete trash we ordered avocado egg roll it never tastes as shitty as we got. Cold. Oily. Bugs were flying on it. So disgusting. the mushroom soup we ordered it was also cold and salty and as well as the filet mignon my dad couldn&#39;t eat his food and as soon as we get home he threw up everything he ate. <br> just to get the table was like 45 minutes and it wasn&#39;t even that crowded and another hour to get the filet mignon.. this place wasn&#39;t like this before. I will never go back to that place again it&#39;s complete trash !

Usually I love the Cheesecake Factory but today the service was awful and unhelpful. I ordered the wrong cheesecake to go and asked if I could exchange it because I can&#39;t eat the slice I received and the lady told me I couldn&#39;t because they were different prices, but the prices on the sign were the same and I even pointed that out but still would not help me. Very unhappy.

Went for a quick early dinner with my husband and our son. Waitress was nice and attentive. Space was very clean and well kept. We ordered drinks.. my husbands orange crush was delicious.. my blood orange frozen margarita was more like an orange slushy.. a waste if $13.00. Our buffalo blast app were delicious and very filling despite a few burnt pieces which we were given a piece a cheesecake for the trouble.. once our entrees came we were stuff but I took a couple bites of my crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp. It was great, and the same price as my drink .  Very huge portion!. My husband 4 cheese pasta was pretty mediocre but edible. Overall, our food was cooked properly and we were treated well!

This place rarely disappoints. They have a huge menu that varies from Chinese to Thai to Italian to American cuisine. Everything under one roof. You pretty much can point to anything on their menu and it will come out very delicious.<br>Highly recommend; (apps) Avocado Eggrolls, Thai Chicken lettuce wraps, Ceasar Salad, BBQ Chicken Ranch Salad. For main dish, can&#39;t go wrong with; Chicken Madeira, Orange Chicken, Chicken Marsala and Hibachi Steak (one of my favs).<br><br>Their portion size is a bit intimidating, we always end up having leftovers the next day. <br><br>Only one tip, definitely come here before the dinner crowd or you&#39;&#39;l be waiting from 45 minutes to over an hour for a table. And save room for dessert, they have some amazing assortments of cheesecakes.

The food is amazing. The biggest menu I&#39;ve ever seen. My only complaint is that it&#39;s soooooo crowded here. You feel like you&#39;re sitting next to the person at the other table because you are. That&#39;s not a reflection on the staff or the restaurant because I will come here for my wedding and baby shower and marriage and funeral. This place is great.

Extremely unimpressed with who ever created the menu. Every single pasta or meat dish that said &#34;white wine&#34; or &#34;lemon garlic&#34; sauce actually had cream/dairy in it. That&#39;s not white wine or lemon garlic guys!!! That&#39;s a CREAM SAUCE!!! Kitchen would not even cater to my dairy allergy. If something had dairy in it the server would just come back and say sorry And thaneeded to pick something else. <br>I prefer to go someplace that does not have their food pre-made for god knows how long, and don&#39;t even care for people with allergies. <br><br>Update: They ask for you to contact them about your experience, then ignore you for almost two weeks!! <br>Such a shame I USED TO like it, now this has taken the cake. Never again will I go there.

I dont know how this place is always packed even on weekdays because every time I visit here, everything is below avg. This time we were there 8pm on Tuesday but still had to wait 30minutes. We finally got seated and server came after about 5 minutes. She gave us pre meal bread and took our drink order. After two minute or so, she came back with no drinks asking if we were ready to order. We were ready since we waited for so long. She took the order, didn&#39;t repeat back which caused her to make mistake. She forgot one of our two appetizer and when we asked her, she said &#34;oh i checked and it wasn&#39;t in. I don&#39;t know if i didn&#39;t hear you say it or if you forgot to say it. Sorry. You guys want it now?&#34;  It sounded like she was blaming us for not ordering it and we weren&#39;t unhappy because the food already took long time to come out and wasn&#39;t tasty. <br>I don&#39;t know why I keep go back to this place when I can get better pasta and service at other places.
I like the Cheesecake Factory because it has a selection of main courses and desserts.

One of my favorite chain restaurants , I had great food and good service .I ordered Creole shrimp and andouile sausage . It was good nice alternative cause I always get jambalaya and it&#39;s alot less calories 600 . Only complaint I have is the waitress didn&#39;t ask how my food was so I gave her 15%tip instead of 20%.

I like the Cheesecake Factory - large menu, big space, and pretty big portions. Growing up, I used to think it was the best restaurant ever.  2 hour wait? Sure ill stand by.<br><br>But those times have changed.  The above are all still true, but man, it is pricey.  Now that I&#39;ve gone out and tasted the world, I recognized that the Cheesecake Factory is a chain restaurant that is trying to charge fine dining prices.  $13 for a burrito?? No thanks. <br><br>I still thoroughly enjoy their Cobb salad, my go to entree.  Portion is huge and the dispersement of dressing is perfect.  Their lunch specials are a pretty good deal as well and a decent size.  <br><br>My wife got a vegetable pasta for $15 and wow. It&#39;s literally just thin spaghetti, creamy garlic sauce, and a few vegetables.  Pretty overpriced.  She ordered it without Parmesan, but it was brought out with it.  She already took a bite. Waitress said she&#39;ll have another sent out and we kept the cheesy one.  We ultimately were charged for both, but it doesn&#39;t matter - we did eat them both (shared amongst table).<br><br>As for appetizers, the avocado eggs rolls are a must -  I have never seen this anywhere else.  6 halves for $12 is a bit steep, but worth it.<br><br>The wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive.  Came back numerous times to check on the table.  So that is definitely a plus.<br><br>I go here regularly because I really do enjoy the salad, staff and convenience.  But forget about a Friday/Saturday night - the wait can be long.  I&#39;d recommend this place for casual or even group dining, which is the only time I really go.  Decent food, but not spectacular. If looking for an authentic and romantic atmosphere, seek else wh

Excellent entree options and even better desserts. The only downside is extensive wait times. Almost always a minimum of a 30 minute wait for a table. Prices are also a little on the high side. All worth it though.

This was my first visit to a Cheesecake Factory location. Very convenient for shopping at the Willow Grove Mall, but if I were in the Mall, I&#39;d probably opt for one of the other places in the food court. Our server, Amanda, was great. Very attentive and friendly. Arriving in the early afternoon, we were seated immediately in the patio, at our request. Because of the brutal Mall landscaping (&#34;keep it visible, and they will come&#34;), there are of course no trees around the Mall. Ironic, given the history of Willow Grove Park. So the table umbrellas provide limited shade, and the metal table top - oh my, they can get hot in the sun. We had to move to another table where some shade was available, and Amanda nicely facilitated that. But my complaint is with the restaurant&#39;s pricing. For example, I thought the $3.00 coffee was not a good value for the quality, not that it was bad - but it wasn&#39;t really great either. The same applies to the other items we ordered. The Caesar Salad with chicken ($17) was very large, but reportedly had really dry chicken. The kids Mac n Cheese ($7) gives you a sense of the pricing range. Pricey - about 25% above comparable dining experiences, but without any distinguishing qualities justifying the pricing. There is an extensive menu, and the interior decoration of the restaurant itself looked spectacular, in a kind of touristy way, if you go for that sort of thing.
The Ed W review was so accurate as I was in the same party.   Have been there many times and couldn&#39;t believe that it was that bad this time.

I have been here many times with my family and they have always fresh foods. We ordered grilled ribeye steak and avocado egg rolls  it was delicious as everytime.  Highly recommended this place to everyone.

I like this place, for a chain restaurant it is really quite nice. The menu is extensive but if I had to pick a favorite item it would be the avocado egg rolls. They are dynamite. Also happy hour is a good time! Definitely hit them up for that if you get the chance.

I love this place and at one time I probably would have given it a 5 but the quality has decreased slightly in food prep. Cheesecake Factory is always one of my go tos because of their extensive and varietal menu as well as their awesome drinks and well - cheesecake- duh! I tend to always get the same thing though - stick to the favorites - which means that I can tell that the quality of a particular dish is decreasing. For example the past few times I&#39;ve gone and ordered the Louisiana Chicken the sauce has been super oily and not at all creamy and there&#39;s been less and less chicken. Overall the taste is good, the value isn&#39;t bad, and the service is great. Don&#39;t sit outside outside of the restaurant inside of the mall, if you get seated there just wait until a table opens up inside. The outside tables are creaky and don&#39;t get cleaned well. I sat out there once on a particularly busy day and although I get why those tables are offered - it expands their seating - you just feel like the unwanted cousins at Thanksgiving dinner banished to the makeshift tables in the other room. But in this case - it&#39;s the mall, who wants to eat inside the mall entrance? Certainly not me. The staff is always really nice though and the food still is good, just not the same standard it used to be.

Ok, I&#39;ve never really been a fan of Cheesecake Factory (food is too salty while at the same time too bland, too greasy, etc.) and yet their cheesecake is not bad. Not amazing, but not bad either. Service is just ok.<br><br>If you&#39;re looking to come here, you&#39;re either in high school looking for a nicer atmosphered place to take your date other than your local McD&#39;s or a family that wants to take their high school kids to someplace &#34;nice&#34; and keep the bill smaller based on how much they eat because the food servings here are healthy at best.<br><br>I came here since my cousin (who&#39;s in high school) begged me to take him here so that he could try it out. I warned him about getting diarrhea and the food quality but he still wanted to go.<br><br>After $50 (I didn&#39;t eat anything) and not finishing the food I paid for, he got diarrhea on the way home. Served him right for not listening to me.<br><br>So, in short, unless your stomach is made out of steel, your taste buds are numb to salt and your heart can take an extra hard beating of fat, then by all means, come here. Otherwise, you might want to spend that money on something healthier or homemade.<br><br>Parking: Large shared lot with mall<br>Wait: Best to make reservations even though I don&#39;t know why people come here<br>Price: $20+ per person

Very loud and tables are very close together.  We went on a Sunday at 1 pm. We were seated within 10 minutes but took at least 10 minutes for our order to be taken. The booth we sat in had a large piece of the material missing from it. Food was good but for a lunch item, smaller than other plates, it&#39;s not worth the price.  On a positive note, our waitress was very pleasant and our order was correct. I dont think we will be back.

Went here with my best friend on a sunday night. We waited almost one hour to be seated, and people that came in before us were seated first, mind you we were only a party of two. When I asked the hostess about it, she told me I was wrong and that we would be called when its our turn. The service was very unprofessional and the prices were outrageous for the portion size and the quality of food. You can tell everything is pre made, nothing fresh and probably nothing prepared on premise. The cheesecake was a small portion, and especially for almost 8 dollars, I want my money&#39;s worth. <br><br>The drink menu was  overpriced, and there were no prices on the actual cocktail section I actually had to ask my server, who didn&#39;t even have a clue. The food was soggy and had way too much sodium in it. The bread that was served to us was hard as a rock, and I actually CUT the top of my mouths&#39; gum open trying to eat it, it was that hard. And the bread was tasteless. Overall, my best friend and I agreed, there are better places around in Willow Grove to go to. This was not worth the price, and I would not go back.

Got a waitress that decided that she could remember our order without writing it down. Waited over an hour for tacos and when they came they were all wrong anyway. Ended up returning them and going to Taco Bell. Thanks for ruining our valentines dinner

Nice people, great food. Highly recommended ahi tartar, really exceptional.  Actually everything what we&#39;ve tried there was excellent.<br>We are used to go to TGI Friday at the same mall, but now only here. This is the best place in Willow Grove mall.

If I could give zero stars I would. I haven&#39;t been to this location in awhile because I prefer the King of Prussia location but tonight was the worse service I ever had. I took my family out for some dinner we tonight and our server got one of my orders incorrect which was ok no biggie that&#39;s fixable but after that she completely ignored us. She kept servicing the table next to us instead. Seems a little racist to me especially since she seemed extra friendly to the table next to us and walked past us a couple times completely ignoring us and didn&#39;t even acknowledge us at all. I grew tired of it and asked for another server for refills and more napkins instead. Server again walks by and ignores us. So then I ask another server if she could grab her manager so I could speak with. 5-7 minutes go by... still no manager. Annoyed I go up to the hostess desk and ask to speak with a manager and told him what was going on. Ironically he too seems racists of Asians because he didn&#39;t seem apologetically at all. I asked him why is that the table right next to us who are African American getting serviced and she&#39;s giving them attention but pays no attention to us at all. All the manager kept did was apologize. I never will here to this location ever again. This was absolutely by far the worse service I have ever received.
Food is good but when ordering take out they don&#39;t include the complimentary bread and butter which is honestly ridiculous. Used to order 3-4 times a week from them. Won&#39;t be anymore.

It&#39;s been a few years since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory, and I&#39;m very disappointed.  The portions shrunk in size -- I had a fettuccine alfredo, and my local pizza place makes a bigger and better tasting version.  We were seated quickly, and initially service was great, but as I write this, we&#39;ve been waiting on dessert for at least ten minutes.<br><br>They&#39;re fast on the free refills.
The food was amazing but the service was average. Wish they could have given us better service but overall a good experience. I wouldnt go back on a weekend.

I&#39;ve been to the Cheesecake Factory 3 times. The  first 2 times were ok, but the last visit did not turn out very well.<br><br>My Family took me there for my B.D. in January. <br><br>My sister and my grandson both ordered a crab  dish. My sister noticed a sour taste, right away, and sent the dish back. My grandson didn&#39;t notice a foul taste, but did get sick with diarrhea later that night.  He didn&#39;t put up a fuss since he felt fine the next morning. <br><br>Me and my son both ordered steak ,mashed potatoes and asparagus. To be kind, The mashed potatoes were under cooked.  there were literally raw lumps of potatoes on my plate.  The asparagus was no better. Pretty much raw as well.<br>I know what rustic mashed potatoes and aldenta vegetables taste like. This was far from it. This was raw food.  You could tell that it had potential if cooked a little more, so I took it home and did just that, and it was much better. <br>Question, should I really have to do that. I think the answer is a resounding Hell No.<br><br>I&#39;m being lenient giving a review of 2 stars because I really hope this was a one off ( maybe they were having a bad night in the kitchen )<br><br>I will go again, because I have a gift card,  and hope for a better outcome.

Delicious filet mignon  one problem they make these unbelievable glazed carrots with Pecans and then they get rid of them and they&#39;re the best thing on the menu and every time we come in we ask the waitresses yes no problem and then the chef gives her a problem and he yells at her they need to just bring it back on The menu<br>I get rid of stuff that actually the people like how hard is it to make<br><br>They make you wait for a drink for ever.  Not happy

I&#39;d always been wary of the Cheesecake Factory, mostly due to their insanely priced cheesecakes themselves. Before my visit here, I&#39;d only ever got cake to go from the KoP location, and despite the good quality, $8 for a slice of cheesecake seems steep.<br><br>Anyway, I ended up at the Willow Grove location last night because a friend wanted to have her birthday party there. I&#39;ll start with the good; the food was (mostly) delicious. I had their loaded nachos (don&#39;t remember the menu name), which consisted of thick nachos that seemed to be fried on premises. I also had the chicken samosas, which were awesome, and while not completely authentic, they had a nice curry flavor that was palatable for American taste buds but still distinctly tasted like an Indian masala. Also, their cheesecake is obviously quite good. I had some of their new s&#39;more edition and it lived up to the hype. Also, I tend to like the decor inside, even if it is quite dark.<br><br>So here&#39;s the cons. My house salad was disgusting - the salad itself was wilted and the vinaigrette they put on it only served to make the aging leaves even more bitter. Luckily, this was the only bad item anyone got and the rest of our food was edible. Worse than this, is that the staff, particularly hostesses, are very rude. They seemed angry we had a large group, and gave us poor accommodations so that one person had to sit on a rickety chair in the middle of the aisle. Also our waitress seemed over worked and barely checked on us, so sadly I personally will refrain from ever going there on a Saturday again, as the attitude was too much.<br><br>For being a chain, it&#39;s not bad. I&#39;ll come again on a week day and do an update, and see if any of my issues are resolved.

My date and I recently (5/30/17)  ate at this restaurant. We both were fans of there Shepherd&#39;s Pie - were, being the operative word. This meal was floating in grease/fat and very salty. It was a huge disappointment.<br><br>Now for the service! It was equally as disappointing. Our waitress was rude - tossing dishes on the table and not once did she come back to our table, during the course of the meal to check on us. When she brought our bill she never asked if we were satisfied or enjoyed our food. <br><br>No return trips for us!!!

Our party of 15 arrived at this location and were seated within an hour. Our server Rebecca was amazing. She was prompt, courteous and polite. We had drinks refilled and everyone&#39;s order met expectations. We celebrated my husband&#39;s 35th Birthday, and the other servers came out and sang to him and comped his Snickers Cheesecake. The proverbial icing on the cake (no pun intended) was that Rebecca actually let us split the check. My husband I were there with 6 other couples and a single person. each married couple had their own check. Don&#39;t ask how she did it...but she did! Amazing! We&#39;ll be back.

Tonight they had a huge wait. This was ok because it was a Saturday night, however, the bathrooms had paper towels over flowing the trash and the waitress did not greet us for over 10 minutes after we sat down. We did not get bread until requested. Food was good and hot but the management and service was not up to par at all.

Food is always fantastic. Today was an 1 and 30 minute wait. I don&#39;t understand why since there were empty tables. <br>Waitress took over 10 minutes to greet us. <br>Seems to be understaffed tonight.<br>Bathrooms were disgusting. No paper towel and over flowing waste baskets and the over flowing trash was being tracked out into the main dining area. <br>This is a case on very poor managerial skills.

This review pertains to the takeout ONLY.<br><br>My avocado eggrolls looked like an experiment gone wrong. In addition, they were soggy, not crispy. The bed of rice noodles were extra stale.<br><br>I feel like I got the reject batch that the cook screwed up on and couldn&#39;t serve to the guests because they could actually see their food and complain about it before paying for it, whereas I could not.<br><br>Typically the food does not disappoint.....but whoever was responsible for cooking tonight (around 8pm) needs to be re-evaluated.<br><br>Currently not too thrilled to re-order.
The best thing to mark this place is the variety.  Had the Ahi tuna plate.  Tasty. My husband had the meatloaf. Ordinary was the way he described it.

I stopped by for lunch on a weekday. They weren&#39;t very busy, and we were quickly seated. Our server was nice, and the service was timely.<br><br>We were served bread first, and it was delicious. Warm and soft, it tasted like it was fresh out of the oven. There were two kinds, one brown and one white. Both were good, but I liked the brown better. It was a little sweet. I did enjoy the crisper crust of the white bread, though.<br><br>I ordered the Thai lettuce wraps. My sister had a kale and quinoa salad, and my mom ordered a turkey sandwich off the &#34;skinny menu.&#34; I was pretty happy with my choice; as a shareable appetizer, it was actually a lot for one person. The three sauces were delicious and so flavorful. The vegetables were fresh, and the red cabbage was particularly delicious since it&#39;s usually so tough in texture. Unfortunately, the texture of the noodles was not good--they weren&#39;t chewy at all. It tasted like they&#39;d been refrigerated to cool down quickly.<br><br>The salad was good, but the dressing made it a little too salty. My mom enjoyed her burger, but I guess there was a caloric price to pay because it looked really small and sad on a large plate. I don&#39;t think she was full, either. So bottom line for the entrées of the day is, yummy with some drawbacks.<br><br>And of course we had to get dessert. This is the only restaurant we ever get dessert. And on those rare occasions in other restaurants when we get dessert, we always get one to share. But at the Cheesecake Factory, each person gets his or her own cheesecake slice. My sister got the strawberry, my mom got caramel du leche, and I ordered the 30th anniversary one, which is cheesecake layered with chocolate cake. The crust is made of chocolate in various forms. It was so rich, I couldn&#39;t get in more than a few bites. But for the next few days, I had a delicious treat in the fridge! Everyone else enjoyed their cheesecake, too.<br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back and try some of the other cheesecakes! The rest of the meal seems only a formality for me.

I&#39;ve been here twice and my biggest complaint is the noise. It&#39;s so hard to hear the other guests you&#39;re with. You have to lean across the table to hear each other. Also the tables are so small. It&#39;s like playing a game of Jenga to be able to put plates and cups on one table. Also because we knew the tables were small we asked for a booth but were told there were none. Clearly there were at least two open booths. It was a late lunch so it wasn&#39;t during a rush service time. I&#39;ve been to three different locations and this is by far the loudest. Not a staff problem but an acoustics.

Their lunch menu includes a wide variety of food to choose from. My to-go to meal is Spicy Chicken Chipotle pasta. It is always delicious.<br><br>The problem with this restaurant is that your experience really depends on which waitor/waitress you end up with. You can end up with one who doesn&#39;t care about you and whether or not you enjoy your food or not. There is no consistency with the staff members.<br><br>The other problem is that they got me cold, hard bread before. I complained and they told me that it will take me 20 minutes to give me fresh bread. I was disappointed with my meal that day.

Never going back to this location again. The silverware on our table was dirty, so I reached over to the table to the right of me and the silverware was also dirty for that table. Then I went to the left of me and again, the silverware was dirty. When asked to speak to a manager, the server said he would be right out. When the manager was informed, all he said was &#34;Oh.&#34; We told him we were going to leave and nothing else was said besides &#34;Okay. &#34; no apologies or even offer a new set of silverware. We will never return to this location.

Well.. the first thing is - for whatever rhyme or reasons, this turns out to be a hangout spot whenever my friends come visiting in to my place. And so far, it has not been a disappointing experience any time.<br><br>This place is pretty crowded for the most part of the time - regardless of the day of the week you walk into. And the not so nice part is that they don&#39;t take in reservations. So, you are definitely getting a raw deal if you are not able to plan much for a free form dining.<br><br>The ambience of the place in itself is pretty good - and also, appears to be kind of standardized all over. I have not seen a different ambience at different Cheesecake factory outlets so far.<br><br>As for the parking - you definitely get the parking space from the mall :) You do have a deal of outdoor dining in an explicit fashion for the summers and there is also an &#34;outdoosy&#34; feel from the mini out door setup within the mall side of the area that is OUTSIDE of the restaurant area itself :D<br> <br>Moving out to the food portion of it - I must admit that though I have been here multiple times with multiple people, I haven&#39;t quite tried a lot of stuff myself. So, some of the review here should be a combination of what I have eaten plus what my friends had along with me.<br><br>The freshly squeezed orange juice - it is a class apart. You don&#39;t get to have automatic refills. But I can safely bet you would only be asking for more when you have a sip of it.<br><br>Chicken di pana - thin slices of breaded chicken cooked to perfection in a white wine sauce. The serving size is pretty generous and therefore, you might even be left wondering how you would be able to complete the accompanying broccoli and mashed potatoes<br><br>Veggie Burger - This is par excellence. Neatly done patties that seem to be quite freshly made from a combination of rice and beans. Brought in with sliced onions, lettuce, tomatoes and jalapenos. The patty is topped with a cheese - and I believe you can let them know your choice of it. <br><br>They have a very extensive menu and I am not hoping to try out everything even with all combinations of folks eating out with me! However, I promise to edit and repost as and when I keep trying newer items

I went here with my mother in law for lunch a few weeks ago. The first thing I noticed was the beautiful high ceilings. It really makes the restaurant look bigger. We were seated at a table fairly quickly as they were not busy at all. I didn&#39;t like how close together the tables were. It didn&#39;t allow for any personal space. The other downside is that they placed people on either side of us making us feel cramped. This was unnecessary as like I said the place wasn&#39;t busy and there was empty tables all over the restaurant. Other than that it was pleasant. Our waiter was phenomenal. I had my daughter with me and he stopped and talked to her and asked me questions about her. The food was great. I was very happy with everything I got and the food was brought out quick.

I pop in to get a slice of cheesecake every month or so. My last visit was so strange...the &#39;server&#39; (she said her name was Melissa&#39;) totally ignored me even though I&#39;d waited a bit and had asked to be served twice. She seemed to want to serve the couple ahead of me even though they had assured her (twice) that they were still deciding and weren&#39;t ready to order. When I did order, she cut me off. Twice. I asked for her name, paid then left. Then noticed she got my order wrong. I won&#39;t be back. <br><br>Maybe it was my Afro.
What do they put in their food that makes you so full?! Food comes out great depending on what you get. Staff is amazing. Wait is FOREVER!

The service is terrible! The takeout/counter service is absolutely horrendous. They are rude and cheesecake is hardly ever fresh. It&#39;s a shame that the service at this location has increasing become worse over the years instead of improving.

We were very disappointed with the service. <br><br>When our pager went off, we waited by the hostess stand with 4 other parties who were waiting to be seated as well. The hostesses were scrambling around trying to decide which tables were bussed and who was to be seated next...it was very unorganized<br><br>At that point we were pretty hungry! My husband ordered steak and it came without a steak knife. So he had to wait for the waitress to come back with a knife. We had to ask for bread which is normally brought out automatically.<br><br>I give the Cheesecake Factory 2 stars for service but 4 stars for taste because the food was very good!

I went here with some friends after an assembly and was very disappointed in how the portion sizes changed. I usually have enough food to take home but this time the portions were so small you could finish them in one setting. I got the shrimp scampi and it was about $20 so for that price to not have left overs I was really disappointed. I hope this is not the norm for all the cf. my friends first reaction was similar. The food was good but just know you will be paying more for less food.

Maybe it&#39;s just because I moved from hicksville and we didn&#39;t have anywhere to eat except for the Olive Garden, but I love Cheesecake Factory. Huge menu and nice, attentive waitstaff. Especially love the mac and cheese burger + sweet potato fries. We always take a slice of cheesecake to go and split at home because we leave way too stuffed.
I LOVE LOVE this place,,,,<br><br>cheesecake selection  OMG ,,,,, this place has the best cheesecake EVER!!!!!! I have been to many different different locations but this one is my favorite.

Wasn&#39;t that thrilled with last nights dinner. The service was ok but nothing special. Hostess staff was very friendly upon arrival and also when we left. <br><br>This dinner was just bleh. The kids pasta was dry and really lacking sauce as was my wife&#39;s chicken Romano dinner. She liked the chicken but really didn&#39;t touch the noodles. We took them with us so we could add sauce at home for leftovers. My burger topped with fontina cheese and Caramelized onions and mushrooms was cooked medium as requested but it was dry too. No burger juice! The side salad was fresh and properly dressed. My moms spicy chili salmon was good all around, maybe a bit too much cabbage on the side but otherwise very good. <br><br>We didn&#39;t do dessert as our little boy needed to get home to sleep but boy did all of those choices look good! With so many options to try we will be back but we will stay away from the pasta and burger dishes.

There aren&#39;t that many decent brunch place in the suburbs so cheesecake factory is my spot on sunday! It has the BEST sunday brunch menu!! I highly recommend the Monte Cristo.... enough said (fyu brunch is only served on Sundays)

Its the Cheesecake factory, what could I really say? I love it and I will continue to go here every chance I get. I pretty much had everything on the menu here as well as the drinks. The service for the most part is pretty good even when its busy.

My wife and I go to cheesecake factory at least 2 times a month. It was quite disappointing after our last experience there. My wife and I ordered the nachos as an appetizer. As we were finishing them up, we then ordered our entrées. Unfortunately my wife started getting a little queasy and sick and requested our meals to go. When we got home we both felt very sick to the point where we spent the remainder if the night in the bathroom. The two meals we brought home (Chicken Bellagio) went to waste since we didnt want to take any chances the next day eating them. I called and spoke to the manager Allie and explained what had happened. Unfortunately she did nothing to rectify the situation.<br>Over all, we are quite dissatisfied and will never return again to any Cheesecake Factory establishment.
Sat us outside in the freezing cold with an infant. Service was slow and staff was rude and unfriendly. Horrible expierence. Only giving one star for the food.

Cheesecake Factory is our go to restaurant when shopping at the Willow Grove Mall.<br><br>My mom and I like to go on Sundays when they offer the extended breakfast/brunch menu.  Recently we went in and they offered a free cheesecake slice gift card for purchasing a $25+ gift card.  We ran into this deal a few times in the past holiday seasons so I bought a gift card and was able to use the gift card right away, but the cheesecake voucher cannot be used the same day.  Which is fine with me, I can wait till later to use it!<br><br>My favorites from the &#34;Brunch&#34; menu which is offered only on Sundays until 3pm are the Bruleed French Toast, Lemon-Ricotta Pancake, and the Baja Chicken Hash.<br><br>The Bruleed French Toast is humongous... well, most of their dishes are, but I&#39;ve never finished the french toast in one sitting.  It&#39;s not an overpowering creme brulee flavor, but just the right amount.  <br><br>Same goes for the Lemon-Ricotta Pancakes.  It has a faint lemon and ricotta taste.  I love lemon flavors in pastries and breakfast items so this is definitely one of my favorites!  It&#39;s usually topped with sliced strawberries but I&#39;ve seen people ask for different fruit toppings and they weren&#39;t charged extra for the replacement.<br><br>For both the sweet brunch dishes, you don&#39;t get any savory sides with them, but you can order meat or a breakfast side if you&#39;d like.  I think the french toast actually does apprear again on the menu with a side included, but I&#39;ve never ordered it that way.<br><br>If I&#39;m not in the mood for something sweet, I always get the Baja Chicken Hash for brunch.  It&#39;s a generous portion with two large crisp tortillas topped with veggies, chicken, beans, and poached eggs.  So delicious!<br><br>Aside from the brunch menu, Cheesecake Factory has so many different options on their menu... it&#39;ll take you a while to look through everything if it&#39;s your first time, but everything is really pretty tasty :) <br><br>My favorites on regular menu:<br><br>Miso Salmon<br>Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta<br>Chicken Bellagio<br>Grilled Shrimp and Bacon Club Sandwich<br><br>Enjoy!

Its as good as any other Cheesecake Factory is! I love cheesecake factory. Large portions, good prices, great food. I mean its nothing spectacular or amazing, just decent food. Especially for lunch or a large party. This one is no exception.

We don&#39;t typically visit many chain restaurants, but my in-laws like this place so we went with them. The food was fine, definitely nothing outstanding but fine. <br><br>We were in a party of 11, and either the restaurant or our specific server didn&#39;t use seating numbers when entering in the order, so that they had to &#34;raffle off&#34; the food when it came. Seeing as Cheesecake Factory is such a large company, I would have thought they&#39;d use seating numbers to distribute the food instead of interrupting everyone to ask who had ordered what. So much more enjoyable for the patrons and much easier for their staff.<br><br>I did like that they had a decent selection of gluten-free options, which was appreciated. The atmosphere is enjoyable, and everyone in the family seemed to have a nice time.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite chain restaurants, plain and simple. Actually, one of my favorite restaurants period.<br><br>First off, Cheesecake Factory has literally the biggest menu I&#39;ve ever seen. To get to the salads, you have to go to somewhere around page 15! Normally, I&#39;d see too menu menu options as a restaurant not knowing what it is, and just throwing everything on a page with a total disregard for quality of the product, not here. Everything I have had here has been nothing less than great. My usual order is the Crispy Chicken Costoletta which is basically a lightly breaded chicken in a lemon sauce, served with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The chicken is divine, and the lemon sauce makes it perfect. Portion size is also huge, I am either beyond full if I finish it, or usually have another meal to take home. The mashed potatoes are good, but nothing to go crazy over. Recently, I&#39;ve been splitting a bunch of appetizers with my friends, tapas style. For appetizers, I&#39;d highly recommend the Tex Mex Eggrolls, Fried Macaroni and Cheese, and the Crispy Taquitos. All are phenomenal. The ones I am not the biggest fan of it the Spinach and Cheese dip (the spinach is flavorless and the cheese is just put on top), and the Quesadilla (chicken just tastes bland and processed). <br><br>The cheesecake deserves its own little section for just how good it is. Caution, the cheesecake is on the pricy side, I&#39;d be much happier if it was a little bit cheaper. Nevertheless, they are all phenomenal. My favorite is Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple, but most of the other ones I&#39;ve had are equally as great. My only recommendation to Cheesecake Factory would be to setup a dessert to sample a bunch of different cheesecakes, instead of paying the price to buy a bunch of them. If this exists already, shame on me for not finding it, but if it doesn&#39;t it needs to in order to taste the bliss of all these cheesecakes at once!<br><br>Atmosphere here is always very nice, and plenty of room in the booths. Service wise, it really can be a bit of hit or miss. Most times my servers have been excellent, but I&#39;ve had a few that were a little slow with things like getting us water, etc. Pricing is also pretty decent, it&#39;s a little bit on the more expensive side, but still worth it for what you are getting. Chain restaurants usually have a stigma attached to them, but Cheesecake Factory delivers on every aspect. This is basically my go to place anytime I&#39;m hungry and want great food.

Came here with my boyfriend on a whim because we couldn&#39;t figure out what we wanted to eat.  I normally dislike chain restaurants but this place is the exception.  We had appetizers for dinner and it was the perfect choice.  We got the fried mozzerlla, tex mex spring rolls and fried chicken sliders.  All were great.  Service was fast and friendly, food came out quickly and everything was flavorful. <br><br>Unfortunately when we left, about 15 staff members decided it was more important to gather behind the restaurant near the dumpsters and fight WWE style (all while recording video on their phones) instead of do dishes/cook food/or serve patrons.  Um what? Yes. 15 of them, all dressed in white, out back, during a work shift, rolling around on the ground - fighting. <br><br>The only reason this is getting 2 stars is because the chicken sliders were the bomb and our server was great. The highschool fightclub going on out back? &#34;Eek! Methinks not.&#34; Honestly, had it not been for wrestlemania, this place would get 3 stars.

Went there for a b&#39;day with family. Garlic bread, omlette, avocado toast was pretty good. Also, margarita and pina colada were above average. But the dessert let us down big time. <br>Mango key lime cheescake &amp; lemon raspberry cheescake were disaster. It seemed they were in freeze for a months and it tasted sour. The service was pretty good.

Cheesecake Factory is a chain - and honestly, feels like one to the core.  This particular one doesn&#39;t stand out for me - lacks the &#34;feel&#34; of the one I grew most familiar with in Miami - and has a certain &#34;roughness&#34; around the edges.  Sitting us outside the restaurant not in &#34;outside seating&#34; but actually &#34;in the mall&#34; didn&#39;t really do it for me.<br><br>The food is &#34;okay&#34;.  Cheesecake standard stuff - honestly, the menu is pretty much &#34;to large&#34; for many groups.  And I&#39;ve had inconsistent results.  Nothing that stood out as especially &#39;bad&#39;, but likewise - nothing that makes it a memorable visit either.  <br><br>i go here mostly for folks that are visiting and have never been to a Cheesecake Factory.  Most of them really seem to love the Cheesecake, so I guess that is a good thing with the name.<br><br>I think overall - my tone of dissatisfaction is with the Price vs. value.  They attempt to market themselves as something .. elegant, etc. But while the environment is generally nice, the food just isn&#39;t worth it.  <br><br>And perhaps I&#39;m not the standard customer - but atmosphere without taste and food isn&#39;t going to win me over.  Not for a restaurant.

Love Cheesecake Factory. Not only is their cheesecake awesome (duh) but the food is really good. Zucchini fries are a favorite of mine. I am also a big fan of the Chicken Romano, aka parm. The menu is huge so there is something for everyone. <br><br>And I was even able to shop in the mall at a nearby store or two while waiting on more than one occasion. Just had to run in and grab something but 2 birds 1 stone. That makes it all the more better!
I love this place! No matter what CCF I go to the staff is always nice and friendly. Plus, I am addicted the Chris Outrageous Cheese cake

Still at the restaurant here for dinner on a Sunday night. This review is not relevant to the quality of the food, but the quality of the service.<br><br>We arrived at 7pm with a party of 8 and were told that our wait would be 20 minutes. We checked in with the hostess about 2-3 times over the next half hour, and was told each time that our table was almost ready. It wasn&#39;t until 8pm that we were finally seated.<br><br>Service was fine getting our drinks out in a timely manner. However, when the bread and butter was brought out, we still had no silverware at our table. After waiting a few minutes unnoticed, we pulled a waitress aside and asked for silverware/table settings. No one had even noticed that we were without table settings.<br><br>5 minutes later, a waiter/busboy(?), came out and plopped two napkins full of silverware at one end of the table and left. No settings were placed, an no one followed up with us. <br><br>I have never felt so disrespected at a restaurant. Honestly, Chick Fil-A gives me better service than this.<br><br>It is now 8:42pm and our entrees have just come out. Maybe if the service through the rest of the night improves I will consider changing this review or writing a new review.

Awful. Waiter was horrible and slow. We had the onion soup and it came out cold not to mention there was a hair in mine. Bad experience in general. The floor was filthy as well. Not at all what I expected. Don&#39;t waste your time or money.
Awesome menu. Been going there so many times. One major flaw? They don&#39;t take reservations. No matter how good you are as a customer. I wish they would accept reservations.

So I visited this Cheesecake Factory numerous times, but yesterday was the best visit I had by far. <br><br>I went with my friend who just loves eating. We got seated quickly and our waitress was highly attentitive. Not only that, my friend accidently poured the entire bottle of ground black pepper into her dish! I&#39;m assuming the lid was not screwed on tight.<br><br>Our waitress offered to ask the chef to make a new dish for my friend, she was so nice! She even brought over a new pepper shaker! <br><br>Overall, we had such an amazing experience, all because of exceptional customer service!<br><br>Although, I do recommend dining during hours that are not as busy.

The food was ok today. I wasn&#39;t wowed. The service was very slow. My favorite thing to eat here today was the fried mac and cheese balls. The cheesecakes were very good though as usual. Marshmallow meringue cheesecake and caramel apple streusel cheesecake. Very good.

Went on Friday at 3<br>Seated right away, Drink;s right away, <br>Wife wanted a few more minutes to order, and the waitress was by a few times.<br>Sheperds pie was real good, and the wife&#39;s Beef Medalions  were excellent in her word&#39;s<br>The waitress was a doll.<br>Haven&#39;t been to a cheesecake factory in quite a few year;s, as we used to go to the Inner Harbour one in Baltimore, which was always good.<br>Still consistently good food, and good service

The bartenders rock. Kevin and Kristen in particular. Every drink is made to perfection, just as your order it. The food is always amazing and comes out very quickly! We love it there! The avocado eggs rolls are our favorite, any pasta dish, or the BBQ chicken salad are my go to&#39;s. And of course the cheesecake is delish!

The cheesecake that I have tasted which was the banana cream was amazing!<br>I had my first slice almost 3 summers ago and still remember it.<br>I go back everyone few months and recently I have only had meals and a few drinks. <br>The drinks they serve are amazing and dinner was good.<br><br>On holidays like today they are incredibly busy which put a damper on the experience. The woman upfront at the cheesecake part of the restaurant was unfriendly and had very few words.<br>Maybe it&#39;s because it was so busy but shouldn&#39;t she have expected that on a holiday?

Moral of the story: Haters gonna hate<br><br>Story: My lovely mother decided to finally eat at a place that does not serve Vietnamese food for once in celebration of her birthday. Excitedly, I asked which cuisine she had decided on for me to take her to. In her cute Vietnamese accent, &#34;CHEESECAKE!,&#34; she announced. In my head, I cringed. Aside from their cheesecakes, I have not eaten here for a long time. So I then silently chanted these thoughts during our car ride:<br><br>+Ridiculous long lines<br>+Horrible service<br>+Fusion food gone wrong<br>+Uneatable humongous portions <br><br>On this particular night, all of my preconceived notions about CF were defied. We arrived on a weekday&#39;s night and were seated immediately much to my amazement. We avoided the usual hordes of hungry patrons holding their buzzers standing around the entrance and exit on any given weekend&#39;s night. <br><br>The quality of food was well-executed. I ordered the bang-bang chicken and shrimp served with brown rice, chile, curry, coconut, and sautéed vegetables. It was very flavorful. I finished it all! Also ordered the vegetarian burger and salads and enjoyed every bite. Washed it all down with a glass of delicious red wine sangria. We then finished off with a heavenly slice of dulce de leche caramel cheesecake. <br><br>Our server, Olena, was extraordinary. Her genuine friendliness and helpfulness was truly appreciated. She paid attention to the small details of our dining experience. It was truly exceptional service for any restaurant, especially a chain. <br><br>Lesson learned- so whatever mom wants she gets. And moms are usually right.

Probably deserves a 2.5 because the food was pretty good, but no 1/2 stars on Yelp. Anyway, had a few problems with this visit. 1st the check in hostess seemed a bit short. Sort of odd to assign a person not all that friendly to that position. Aside from that, we experienced multiple errors with our order &amp; if felt like the wait staff is over worked. (Too many tables per waiter/waitress) This is the 2nd time we&#39;ve had a less than ideal experience at this location. If you are dead set on eating at the CF ... I&#39;d suggest hopping the bridge and going to the Cherry Hill NJ location.

Although it&#39;s a chain, I wanted to comment on this. The wait is always very long but that is so be expected. However, when you are seated you will not be disappointed. The menu is huge and the food is amazing! We had a great waitress on our latest visit. <br><br>Being such a high volume restaurant, they really do accommodate guests!
If you believe in equal treatment for all persons, do not go here! They haphazardly sit all minorities in the outside terrace in the mall area behind the bushes.

this place is okay, we got in on a Monday which was great because we had no line etc. The food is kind of expensive for what it is, and the desert ins&#39;t that great at all. i think i enjoyed the food more then the desert.

The cheesecake factory is good at cheesecake, and worth it. However, It is unlikely that a 25 page menu is all made with fresh ingredients. Like an average diner  restaurant, it has a wide menu with cake behind glass in the front.

I went here with my mom last month and I am so disappointed. I wasn&#39;t expecting Michelin Star food but something decent and flavorful... I got the Jambalaya which is my go to... This time food was awful service was questionable and when I made mention of it to the server he(Hugo) didn&#39;t care and the manager was &#34;unavailable&#34;. Definitely will not go back to this location. Oh and the drinks were watered down.<br><br>If the food is going to suck at least make me a little tipsy so I won&#39;t care as much :/

They deal with their customers perfectly. <br>The food may be on the expensive side but it is well above worth it. <br>Although it&#39;s called &#34;The Cheesecake Factory&#34; their deserts consist too much of the normal desert items on the menu or any other resteraunt of it&#39;s type. <br>I believe if they add more specialty desert and dinner items, they will bring in more customers as well as myself more often.

I like the Cheesecake Factory because it has a large menu for different tastes and huge portions, however, I do not like this particular location.<br><br>Me and the boyfriend go to the Cheesecake Factory strictly because we love the avocado egg rolls. The two visits we had at this location, we ordered them and then the server would come back saying that they were all out. I would understand them running out of something one time, but BOTH visits? It just leads me to believe they are doing something wrong if they can&#39;t keep a very popular item &#34;in stock.&#34; <br><br>Probably won&#39;t go out of my way to return to this location since both visits were disappointing.
I enjoy one thing at the reataurant and that&#39;s the red velvet cheesecake however once I saw the calorie and fat count I don&#39;t bother going there at all

Let me keep this short. At the risk of sounding like a dick, it&#39;s a popular suburban restaurant with all of the issues that might suggest.<br><br>We had a 1 hour wait before we were seated, which was much longer than promised. But, ok, it was a Friday night. Apparently 5 large tables had been there for over 2 hours. So not really their fault. But we were all very, very hungry.<br><br>Bland food, sans the fried macaroni and cheese. That was awesome. The guacamole needed salt, and my eggplant sandwich was pretty gross.  The cheesecake slices (cookie dough and s&#39;mores) that my table of 7 split were good. <br><br>I have eaten at a few of these locations, and it was all pretty normal, but the reason I&#39;m bothering to review this one is because my friend got food poisoning from her orange chicken and found a large shard of glass in her leftovers. So 2 stars it is.

My review on The Cheesecake Factory would get an A++ when it came to the service I received while dining last night.  The waitress was extremely nice and attentive.  But, alas, my review is 2 stars because of the food.<br><br>Before I was a vegetarian, I really enjoyed the CF.  The chicken and dumplings were de-licious.  Last night my friend and I were meeting at a local Vietnamese restaurant, but they happened to be closed for the Chinese New Year (sad face).  So we opted to go here instead.  I thought to myself &#39;I just saw someone on youtube raving about their veggie burger - I have to try it!!&#39;<br><br>No.  No, no, no.  It was not de-licious.  It was probably the worst veggie burger I&#39;ve had.  I&#39;m not sure why restaurants feel like people who don&#39;t eat meat want a mushed together patty of rice and some other vegetables I couldn&#39;t even tell you were in their based on taste.  That doesn&#39;t replicate a burger at all.  I sadly would have been happier going to Red Robin.  So there&#39;s the lesson you can take away from this review - if you are a veghead and want a burger you are going to enjoy - skip the Cheesecake Factory and head directly to the nearest Red Robin and order their Boca burger!

We&#39;ve been here enough times as it is local to have tried a good variety of their menu. <br>First, the menu is huge and should accommodate anyone. <br>Food prices are fair but the beer is too expensive. I believe they charged $7 for a bottle of yeungling lager. I rarely drink but the Diet Coke I ordered was no good (tasted old) so I decided to send it back and get the beer. <br>Like most people, we eat quickly so we can get to the dessert. The cakes are all amazing. I would usually get the &#34;low carb&#34; cheesecake and it is always good. We came for our sons bday recently and shared the &#34;tuxedo&#34; cheesecake. It was phenomenal.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to eat. The menu is enormous - I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever seen a bigger one - so you have a lot to choose from. The food is all delicious, and of course there are about a hundred different desserts. They also have a full bar and lots of specialty cocktails. I like the outdoor seating, and the place is open really late! They don&#39;t close until 12:30 am on weekends and 11 pm on Sundays and during the week!
The fish and chips  I have to  be honest very nasty and greasy i could not eat them!!!  Manager was very very nice and refunded the money .

Usually love the food. But the service was a turn off. A half hour wait turned into over an hour wait. One would think when the buzzer rings your good but no we turned that in just to wait some more because the tables weren&#39;t cleared or someone wanted to change their seats. A help wanted sign would surely help that. Food was okay but when dining at The Cheesecake Factory dessert is usually a big part of the meal right? The waitress asks do you want a dessert menu then immediately walks away before we can respond. And returns minutes later with the bill. Not good service at all!
Now that they have every item calorically rate it spoils the whole experience! And who would eat the cheesecake st a whopping 1400 calories?  Terrible.

I just had one of my worst dining experiences at this restaurant. My boyfriend and I had a table outside and waited for almost an hour for our food. I ordered the tomato basil pasta and he had the Steak Diane and salmon. When the food finally arrived, both our dishes were slightly cold and his steak was over-cooked. We told the waitress who took his dish back to the kitchen. The pasta wasn&#39;t too bad so we kept it. Until I noticed there was a stray spaghetti noodle in the penne. We called the waitress over who had a long explanation of how it &#34;happens all the time.&#34; Finally, my boyfriend&#39;s dish was replaced. The steak was not flavorful at all and not worth the money we paid for it. We finished our meals and left incredibly dissatisfied. We forgot about the whole experience until, a few hours later, my boyfriend began to experience a stomach ache and eventually developed nausea. Over the course of the next 10 hours, he has had intense stomach pain and threw up five times. He didn&#39;t eat anything the entire day besides the steak dish which led to one conclusion: he got food poisoning from the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>If you&#39;re in the market for food poisoning and a horrible dining experience, then I&#39;d recommend this location. Meanwhile, I am in the process of filing a report with the local health department.

Came here for Mother&#39;s Day brunch. The wait wasn&#39;t too long, appx 10 minutes. I would&#39;ve rather waited longer at a better restaurant. I usually have a good experience here but this time, something was not quite right with the food. I ordered a brunch special- chicken and waffles with eggs Benedict. Sounds delicious right? Nope! The waffles were ok. The chicken was moist but was smothered in the hollandaise sauce so I couldn&#39;t taste the flavor of the chicken. I don&#39;t understand the little potatoes they give you as a side  why not regular size potatoes or hash browns? Anyway, my husband ordered a breakfast combo, pancakes, eggs and bacon. Nothing spectacular. The best part of my meal was the carrot cake I ordered to go. Despite the less than mediocre food, I&#39;d still go back b/c their menu is so extensive that I could try something different each time and hope it tastes good. *the waitress was very nice and attentive.

Did not enjoy it at all.  We went for our anniversary dinner and they sat us in the mall seating?  Who does that?  They did move us when i complained.  If I wanted to eat in a food court I would not have gone to a restaurant.  Had the appetizers and they were good then ordered the steak medium.  Steak came out rare and was very tough. Could not cut it at all. I mean you would have needed a saw to cut through this thing.  I was really looking forward to having dinner here paid over the top money for dinner and did not enjoy it at all.  They did not charge me for my steak dinner and did comp my desert, which ended up upsetting my stomach.  Needless to say  I would never ever go there again.  I&#39;ve had better steak at Applebee&#39;s in Bensalem for much less money and much better seating and have never left feeling sick.
Cheesecake factory is extremely consistent as far as I&#39;m concered. They also make a great burger for a reasonable price . Solid all around. Great service too.
Very diversified menu. Excellent service. Leave room for dessert. Margot was our waitress and she treated us extra special as we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary.

Didn&#39;t even come here for an actual meal, just for cheesecake and while the cheesecake itself is fine, the speed of the service was a little much. It was difficult to tell where the line to order was with the crowd of people around the counter and after we ordered, it took 20 minutes just to receive a single slice of cheesecake (after also watching several people who ordered after us get their order before us). Wouldn&#39;t recommend if you&#39;re in a rush.
Everytime I come here with great expectation! I love pasta and hibachi steak :) they also have great salted caramel cheesecake !!

Not that great at all!   The place was not full at all and we were seated next to a wall!   Our food was only mediocre, but the worst part was the cheesecake counter!!!   Could not even get a slice of cheesecake in a reasonable amount of time!   Left without it and bought it somewhere else that was even better than I can get there!    This was my 3rd attempt to eat at this &#39;upscale&#39; place hoping to love it and disappointed every time.   The service was not good other times.    There are too many good places around to even consider going back!

Dined here July 21. Around 6:30pm. Had salmon Alfredo. The chef used pure garlic no other seasoning. Very bland!!! Had to ask for seasoning. My friend had shrimp with the thin pasta and his noodles were stuck together!!! Clumps on his plate!!! He doesn&#39;t believe in sending back. Shaking my head service was slow. Server never really checked on us. CCF falling off. Had to take my meal home to season it up. Then I believe it gave me the bubble guts!!!!  My cheesecake was good!!!! Shaking my head. Break time. Off to Bonefish I go.

Great food nice sandwiches with changeable side options great pasta tacos enchilladas I love the shrimp scampi and steak Madeira nice drinks the appetizers are the best egg rolls crab cakes and fire cracker salmon

Ok, Been here many times before. Must of ordered the HIbatchi Steak a dozen times. Usually pretty awesome. This time was Terrible. First of all it was missing the sauce that it usually comes with which I believe makes the whole dish. Second the meat was t uff and didn&#39;t have any flavor to it. The dish was over loaded with to many Onions. Needless to say we were very disappointed.

We enjoy our meals every visit! Most of the time I go with the eggroll sampler, which I have cravings for often. Another fave is the miso salmon, sauce is incredible! Hubby tries something different almost every visit, and is always satisfied with his food. Warm buttered wheat bread is also great!.. We never eat the white bread, just ask to substitute for extra wheat. <br><br>Cheesecake is good, I have tried others here, but classic strawberry is my fave. Generous size, after dinner one slice is enough to share.. I was a bit disappointed to find out from a worker that the cheesecake is not made fresh there, it is delivered frozen. Considering it is the &#34;Cheesecake Factory&#34;.. But I guess that&#39;s expected considering they are a chain. <br><br>Ambience is nice, soft lighting and nice music. Although always super noisy and packed whenever we go. Our first visit we were seated at one of those tightly packed tables, very uncomfortable sitting so close to people on both sides, too intimate. We could hear the whole conversation of both parties. Now we always wait for booth seating even if it takes an extra few minutes. And if it&#39;s a nice day out, outdoor seating is also much quieter, and you rarely have to wait to be seated. <br><br>Food is reasonably priced and portions are generous.

I had the worst experience here. The server was great, but my order came out completely wrong. The manager Jennifer was very rude, gave me an attitude and acted like it was my fault. Will never dine here again. Especially with the current manager on staff.

Cheesecake choices galore. Their portions are big enough for a family of four. That wasn&#39;t supposed to rhyme. <br><br>Yummy treat and even an impressive dinner menu, but too many choices for someone who is easily overwhelmed (me).

This place sucks. I really wanted to like this CKF but it sucks. I have come here 5-6 times and every time I am disappointed. We go to the King of Prussia. KOP CKF is better. It might be the chef. The Chicken Madera is terrible here.  This is my favorite dish. I wish a new owner took over.

Nice place, service was very good too. Food was good although we just had burgers. Had 1 adult beverage and it was well made, daughter had the strawberry lemonade for $5 which was too sweet for me. All in all I liked the place but dinged it for the prices. In my opinion $110 for a family of 5 (3 adults, 2 kids) was a bit much.

Friday night 945. Pretty busy but not jammed. 10 min wait. Taken to a table. Under the table someone had spilled a plate of saucy pasta and salad. It had been partially cleaned up. But there was still plenty on the floor to soil your shoes. An area a foot in diameter with a constellation of romaine pieces. We told the hostess. A guy came by with a broom and dust pan, which would not have cleaned up Pasta sauce. We told the multiple hostesses. Who had no comprehension or concern. We were willing to stay and asked for another table. The hostesses ignored that request. They were much more interested in their own social interactions. We spoke to the manger, who would have given us a different table, but by that time we just wanted to leave.  Sad. It&#39;s usually pretty nice there and the food is generally excellent. Unfortunately, many of their staff--at least the 3 hostesses, a waiter and a waitress lack basic public service skills and accept mediocrity.

Went to cheesecake Factory last night the host was very pleasant. After being seated our waiter came over to take our order he was alittle impatient with our decision to order our food we had a party of 7. We ordered appetizers we were told by our waiter that the buffalo wings were mild hot so my mother which is 91 yrs old could not eat them because they weretoo hot &amp; my son ordered crab dip which was cold should been at least warm so my son asked our waiter to heat the dip up well when it came back out it looked like half of it was missing strike 2 my son &amp; his lady informed our waiter that it appeared to be less now well our waiter got a attitude and snatched it off the table. Well we noticed his attitude. He never gave us his name. When my son food came out it had a long strand of hair on his plate we informed our waiter about the hair &amp; asked to speak with the manager. We saw the manager speaking to the waiter &amp; then they left well my son got upset that the manager took a while before addressing the problem at our table. The manager apologized to my son &amp; offered to make him another dinner on the house. We also asked the manager to send us another waiter in which he did her name was Sharon much better service . Needless to say my son didnt enjoy his birthday dinner. Also my grilled salmon was dry &amp; overcooked. Will not be going back to that one.

Friday nite dinner celebration birthday with 12 people. They only said they could split party and couldn&#39;t seat everyone together, but saw them set up to tables for 12....I had the lemon butter chicken..with asparagus and mashed potatoes...very delicious - asked for a generous amount of the lemon butter sauce...table said BBQ salmon and herbed salmon was good.  Pasta with shrimp was dry and shrimp overcooked. Tablemate didn&#39;t enjoy it.

I&#39;m giving this location 4 stars because of its location.<br>Afterall, everything is about location, location, location.<br>Plus, it&#39;s new. <br><br>It&#39;s new - It&#39;s spacious for the most part. The &#34;feng shui&#34; of it is a little off. It&#39;s like some weird geometric shape - you feel like you are in huge corridors (kinda like a V shape) instead of one big room.<br><br>The service is okay. They seem a little bit flustered when taking your order - and I&#39;ve gone more than a handful of times.  <br><br>Bring a coat - it&#39;s freeeezing. I went in the fall &amp; winter of 2007. They apparently don&#39;t turn on their heat - I was shivering every single time I went. <br><br>Parking is great. <br><br>Whenever I go to Cheesecake Factory - I always order the Corncake Tamales appetizer. This location&#39;s presentation was ehhh..and the cakes were loose (still yummers though).<br><br>Peep the pix.

Went here today after church hoping for a delicious meal that Cheesecake Factory usually provides. I recently visited Cheesecake Factory in lawrenceville NJ and it was a very bad experience. I decided to go to the one in cherry hill nj and it was worse. First the meals took very long to come out and it was only chicken and shrimp that me and my family ordered. Second there were flies all over the restaurant constantly landing on my food and on our drinks. The floors,table and silverware were extremely dirty. I&#39;m totally giving up on a great dining experience because these restaurants just don&#39;t care anymore.

Seated within 5 minutes on Sunday evening. Waitress came by several times until we were ready to order. Drinks within 5 minutes of order with free refills done without us asking. Food generous portions with prices in line with similar establishments.

What can be said about Cheesecake Factory that isn&#39;t already known. The food is overpriced and bland. The service is slow and terrible. The wait is obscene. Waited for an hour at 12:30 on a Sunday afternoon despite originally being told there would be little to no wait. How does this place even stay in business?
The address showed on yelp is wrong but good taste! So enjoy! I order the old fashion burger, taste so gooood（＾＾）

I don&#39;t know what happen here but food has gone down the tubes. Salad was old and looked tasteless.  Kids fruit side was laced with sugar.  I plan to stop coming here and try other restaurants around here.  I love the brand but this location is sub par.

Wow, this is way better than the KOP location.<br><br>We came here last night for dinner (and granted it was like 4) and there was no wait. The whole restaurant has a really nice ambiance with the details on the ceiling and dim lighting.<br><br>Our waitress was pretty cool too. We got everything in a timely manner and she was pretty good with refills on our drinks too.<br><br>Plus the portions were very generous. I had the lunch menu portion of the margherita pizza and salad and wasn&#39;t able to finish it!

I been going to Cheesecake Factory for years, so I took few friends who never been there before the experience this time was definitely not 4 stars it was More like 2. First of all, our waiter was so in rush he didn&#39;t show much interest until it was check time, very disappointed with service today. First 20 minutes we waited for bread and butter to show up!! Even that I had to ask him:( he was stopping at the table for split second and run to the next one!! He became all nice and sweet at the end, my friends were not amazed with either service or food. Cheesecake Factory used to be really good not sure what happened. I won&#39;t be going to Cheesecake Factory near future.

Service - bad service, took 30 min to get our bread, had to reach for another plate at a different table, waitress spilled steak plate sauce on my white ultraboost shoes and didn&#39;t even notice.  <br><br>Food -  It was good but it was not what I asked for.  I Ordered the steak Diane medium rare but received it medium well. It took 1 hour to receive our meals for a table of 5.  By the time the food came,  my dad had already fallen asleep. <br><br>Experience - I didn&#39;t have a good time eating at this cheese cake factory.

Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo - creamy goodness mhmm. I love it soo much. I&#39;ve only gotten that. The last time I was able to order a smaller portion. I love having that option! <br><br>My friend got a pomegranate martini - she seemed to love it. And we both got a piece of red velvet cheesecake. OMG! Why does it have to be so good! I wish there was a location closer to my hometown of Bethlehem. I gotta try something different the next time but I just love the chicken Alfredo so much. I&#39;m hesitant to try something new!<br><br>We spent $30 each - only b/c I was being greedy and bough an EXTRA piece of cheesecake to take home.

Aside from all the fancy dishes I just always get a ribeye steak medium well... it&#39;s awsum and then Linda&#39;s fudge cake just fyi your not gonna find a better steak and cake in the same place ever  service could be better but come in its always a full house there

The hostess on Saturday night, 9/23/17, was atrocious. My husband and I stood there for a good 30 minutes observing how she treated the customers approaching the podium. She never once greeted them.
